Pertenece al banco comunal “Unión por el trabajo” y le gusta ser parte de un grupo sólido y responsable. De recibir el préstamo podrá comprar 20 sacos de papas, los que comercializará en la ciudad de La Oroya.
texts.en:
Marcelina, age 25, has lived with her life partner for five years.  They have a five year old son, Admir.  They live in their own house in the Cayán settlement in the Huasahuasi district.  Marcelina grew up surrounded by crops and open fields.  This is the way she learned to work the land and to get the most from her production.

She started planting potatoes and peas.  Now that she has her own family she grows smaller quantities of potatoes.  Her main job is buying and selling potatoes.  She gets her merchandise in her zone because the potatoes from Cayán are in great demand.  She transports the sacks to the city of La Oroya.  Her sister lives there, so she saves a lot in food and lodging.  She has a sales stand in that city.

“Every week I take 30 sacks of Andean potatoes, which are the ones that sell the most,” she says.  Marcelina is a businesswoman, and she is almost always traveling.  This way she has neglected her other parcels of land.  Now she only has one, which she does not neglect because of the investment she made.

This is the way that she looks for financial stability in order to support her son and to provide him with comforts that she was not able to have when she was young.

This will be Marcelina’s sixth loan with MFP.  She is happy to work with this entity that supports her entrepreneurial process.  She belongs to the Unión por el Trabajo communal bank.  She likes being part of a supportive and responsible group.  Upon receiving the loan she will be able to buy 20 sacks of potatoes, which she will sell in the city of La Oroya.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Magda Denis

texts.es:
La señora Magda tiene 48 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 13,16 y 19 años, reside en el Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbará.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de cacahuate (mani), con las ganancias obtenidas decidió establecer el negocio de venta de mercadería de manera ambulante (calzado para damas, caballeros, niños y ropa interior). Doña Magda cuenta con experiencia crediticia ya que ha solicitado su sexto préstamo por la cantidad de 13,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de calzado y ropa en general. Doña Magda comenta que con las ganancias que ha obtenido de su negocio ha logrado comprar utensilios para su hogar y proporcionarles el estudio a sus 3 hijos. Ella planea a futuro establecer su negocio de manera estacionaria en su vivienda y lograr la sostenibilidad económica.
texts.en:
Magda, age 48, is the single mother of three children, ages 13, 16, and 19.  She lives in the Azacualpa municipality, Santa Barbará.

She previously sold peanuts.  With the income she received she decided to establish a business of selling merchandise (women’s, men’s, and children’s shoes and underwear) in an itinerant manner.

Magda has loan experience.  She has requested her sixth loan for 13,000 lempiras.  She plans on buying footwear and general clothing.  Magda says that with the income she has gotten from her business she has managed to buy utensils for her home and to provide an education for her three children.

In the future she plans to establish a stationary store in her house.  She also plans to achieve financial sustainability.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shoes and clothes) to sell.

loans.name: Beddeh

texts.en: Beddeh is 38 years old, married and lives in Buchanan with two children between 11 and 21 years old. She runs a shop where she sells shirts and artificial hair in her community. She is requesting a loan to buy wigs and shirts for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy wigs and shirts for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old, married to Jecton and blessed with 6 children. She sells secondhand clothes, a business she ventured into a year ago. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. 

She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase bales of skirts and t-shirts for sale. The profit she earns from this business would help her repay her loan and also provide for her family's basic needs. 

Her dream is to see her business expand to a wholesale shop. This is her second loan.

loans.use: to purchase bales of skirts and t-shirts for sale.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julián de 31 años de edad, convive con Mery Luz con quien tiene 2 hijos: Aldair de 3 y Yesdi de 2 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia en el distrito de Tapo, provincia de Tarma. Hace 10 años que Julián se dedica a la agricultura. Es  lo que el gusta hacer. Con la ayuda de su esposa puede desempeñarse en esta labor con la siembra de: arvejas, papas y ollucos. “Me va bien en la siembra, siembro 2 veces al año arveja”, comenta, orgulloso de la cantidad de su producción. Ya que cosecha alrededor de 80 sacos, los que vende con éxito en el mercado mayorista de Tarma.
Así también cuenta con animales, como: 3 vacas, 3 cerdos y 5 carneros; los que cría para luego venderlos. Antes tuvo algunas dificultades como la falta de capital para invertir en sus sembríos, pero gracias al trabajo con MFP, pudo salir adelante poco a poco.
Con esas actividades puede asegurar a sus hijos y esposa una calidad de vida decente y con miras hacia el progreso. Ahora tiene pensado arrendar más terrenos para producir más papas y arvejas. Éste sería su crédito número 11 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Río Blanco”, y le agrada compartir experiencias con compañeros igual de responsables que él.
Julián de recibir el dinero del préstamo podrá comprar 1 bolsa de semillas de arvejas y con lo restante comprará fertilizantes orgánicos (Guano de corral) para garantizar su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Julián, age 31, lives with Mery Luz.  They have two children, three year old Aldair and two year old Yesdi.  They live in their own house in the Tapo district in the Tarma province.

Julián has devoted himself to farming for ten years.  It is what he likes to do.  With the help from his wife he is able to carry out this work with the planting of peas, potatoes, and “ollucos” (a root vegetable).  “I am doing well in the planting.  I plant peas twice a year,” he says, proud of the quantity of his production.  He harvests around 80 sacks, which he successfully sells at the wholesale market in Tarma.

He also has animals; he has three cows, three pigs, and five sheep.  He raises them in order to sell them later.  He previously had some difficulties like the lack of capital to invest in his crops, but thanks to working with MFP he was able to gradually get ahead.

With these activities he is able to assure his children and his wife of a decent quality of life with a look towards making progress.  He now is thinking of leasing more land in order to produce more potatoes and peas.

This will be his eleventh loan with MFP.  He pledges to make his monthly payments punctually.  He belongs to the Río Blanco communal bank.  It pleases him to share experiences with his companions who are as responsible as he is.

Upon receiving the loan he will be able to buy one bag of pea seeds.  With the rest he will buy organic fertilizers (farmyard guano) in order to guarantee their growth.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a single woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 20 to 27 years old. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a school where she provides education. She has been involved in this business for 7 years and employs 15 staff members. Her business is located in a strategic area and her primary customers are school children. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for buying the desks. She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more desks. Beatrice's business goal is to increase her number of students within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more desks.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 35 years old, married and blessed with four children, ages 15, 12, 8 and 6 years old, respectively. Juliet owns a salon, a business she started 6 years ago. She earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

She has requested a loan of 35,000 KES to purchase chemical oil, weaves and braids. The anticipated profit will help her pay back her loan well. Her dream is to open a boutique and cosmetics shop in future. This is her second loan.

loans.use: to purchase chemical oil, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en: Melanya is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and son. Melanya has been engaged in the agricultural business for 5 years. She runs a greenhouse, where she cultivates different kinds of fruits and vegetables. Melanya wants to improve the greenhouse conditions, which is important for her to insure good harvest. This loan will help Melanya to pay for the renovation of the greenhouse, as well as to purchase seeds to cultivate. Melanya expects a good harvest and increase of income, which will help her to improve her conditions in her household.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and green house renovation

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 36 years old, married and blessed with three children who are 15, 12 and 7 years old. She practices dairy farming, a business she started 10 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. She has requested for a loan for KES 40,000 to buy animal feed and to repair her animal shed. She will use the profits she expects to earn to improve her business. She hopes to buy more animals and to succeed in her business. This is her second loan.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and repair an animal shed.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en: Dorris 37 years old and lives in Buchanan with her husband and children. Her children are in school, and for the last 20 years she has earned a living by selling palm oil in the local market. A friend helped her start this business, and she is applying for a loan to buy more palm oil to sell. She hopes to build a new home for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, de 38 años, es una hombre bueno y trabajador, está casado y tiene tres hijos de 9, 5 y 2 años. Él trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia a quienes protege y cuida en su casa propia que pudo construir gracias a que su padre le regalo el terreno.
El trabajo de Carlos consiste en el transporte de carga y pasajero dentro y fuera de la ciudad, cuando algún pasajero desea llegar sano y salvo a su destino él está presto para movilizarlo, pues una de sus virtudes es ser muy cuidadoso y sobre todo de tener la experiencia necesaria para poder transportar si dificultades a sus eventuales pasajeros. Lleva realizado éste trabajo por 18 años.
Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite tener tiempo para poder estar a lado de su familia, además de poder movilizar a sus hijos a la escuela y a diferentes partes que necesiten ir. Recuerda que empezó con éste trabajo muy joven y poco a poco fue ganando experiencia gracias a los días de trabajo que a veces se tornan muy incómodos cuando el sol está muy fuerte o cuando las lluvias son tantas que inundan algunas partes de la ciudad. Espera seguir trabajando y fiel a su estilo seguir aportando a su familia la tranquilidad de poder crecer. Este será el tercer préstamo con MFP, está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas muy responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará algunas piezas y repuestos para su mototaxi, además de regularizar sus documentos ya que están a punto de vencer.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 38, is an outstanding and hardworking gentleman. He is married and has three children (ages 9, 5, and 2). Carlos works very hard because he wants to protect his family and provide them a better quality of life. He also takes care of his own home, which he was able to build thanks to a gift of land from his father.

Carlos has a job that consists of transporting cargo and passengers within and outside of the city. When passengers want to reach their destination safe and sound, Carlos offers them a ride. One of his virtues is that he is very careful. He has the necessary experience for transporting potential passengers and dealing with any difficulties. Carlos has been in this line of work for 18 years.

He enjoys his work because it allows him to have time to spend with his family. In addition, he is able to take his children to school and to different places as needed. Carlos remembers starting out in this line of work at a very young age. Over time, he gained experience as a result of the days of work that were sometimes uncomfortable because of the intense heat of the sun or the heavy rains that would inundate some parts of the city. Carlos hopes to continue working and supporting his family without problems so that they can grow.

This will be his third loan with MFP. Carlos is very pleased to know that he will have financial support since he is confident that he will advance his business. In addition, he promises once again to complete his payments just as he did with his previous loans. He is grateful to be part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. With the loan of 1500 PEN that he requested, Carlos will buy a few spare parts for his motorcycle taxi. In addition, he will renew his documents that have already expired.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi and to renew his driver's license.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en: Emanuel is 25 years old and single. He describes himself as honest, and has for the last three years run a general store where he sells items such as sodas, plates, cups, cooking pots, etc. His business is located in a densely populated area and his main customers are the general public. He describes his biggest challenge as inadequate funds for improving his business. He will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy more products to sell that people use in their homes, such as sodas. Emanuel's business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия с мужем и двумя маленькими детьми живет в городе Белая Церковь недалеко от Киева. Она торгует овощами, фруктами, семенами для рассады, а также хозтоварами для сада и огорода. Наталия мудро установила небольшую наценку на реализуемый товар. В сочетании с хорошим проходным местом торговли, отоплением в киоске, где хранятся овощи и фрукты на продажу, работой напрямую с поставщиками товара, это дает Наталии определенные преимущества в ведении бизнеса по сравнению с конкурентами. 

Наталия занимается этим видом деятельности уже 3 года. Начав свое дело из-за отсутствия нормальной работы с приличной зарплатой, Наталия только радуется тому, что однажды решила открыть свой бизнес. Она планирует вложить полученные от КИВА средства в размере 8 000 гривен в приобретение семян для рассады и земли для цветов. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Nataliya, her husband and two small children live in the town of Belaya Tserkov, not far from Kiev.  She sells vegetables, fruits, seeds for planting and also tools for gardening and farming.  Nataliya wisely included a small add-on cost to the products she sells.  A combination of factors, such as a good, well-traveled place of business, heating in the kiosk, where vegetables and fruits for sale are stored, working directly with product suppliers, give Nataliya certain advantages in running the business as compared to her competitors.  Nataliya has been involved in this business for three years.  Having started her own business due to the absence of regular work with a decent salary, she is only glad now that she once decided to open her own business.  Nataliya plans to invest the loan in the amount of 8 000 hryvnia, received from Kiva, into a purchase of seeds for planting and soil for flowers.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting and soil for flowers

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es:
Ovidio de 41 años convive con su pareja, con quien tiene 4 hijos: Sherly de 15, Tania de 12, Roy de 8 y Ruth de 4 años de edad. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia en la localidad de Yuracmayo, distrito de Tapo. Ovidio se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 20 años, empezó ayudando a sus padres en las labores del campo, de esa manera aprendió y ahora se desempeña en esa actividad para mantener a su familia.
En sus terrenos propios siembra: arvejas, habas, y papas; pero afirma que el producto que más satisfacciones le genera son las arvejas, las que comercializa en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. 
El trabajo es duro, por eso muchas veces tiene que contratar personal operario para que le ayuden a cosechar. Ovidio también labora como operario en otras parcelas de cultivos. “El trabajo de la comunidad es solidario y todos nos ayudamos”, menciona. También posee animales como son vacas, las que le proporcionan leche, la que su esposa vende en su propia localidad. De esa manera mantiene a su familia, con la finalidad que no le falte lo necesario. Ovidio está contento con su trabajo por que es, lo que le gusta hacer. Éste sería su préstamo número 11 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Río Blanco” es el nombre de su banco comunal, menciona sentirse cómodo y satisfecho con sus compañeros por tener los mismos intereses de superación. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas. Cada una cuesta 600 soles y tiene 25 kilos, lo necesario para que Ovidio inicié otra siembra.
texts.en:
Ovidio, 41, lives with his spouse with whom he has four children: Sherly, 15, Tania, 12, Roy, 8 and Ruth, 4.  They all live together in a house of their own in Yuracmayo, Tapo District.  Ovidio has been farming for more than twenty years.  He started out helping his parents with the farming chores and this is how he learned; now he carries out this activity to support his family.  On land of his own he grows peas, lima beans and potatoes but he affirms that the product that generates the most profits is peas which he sells in the Tarma wholesale market.

The work is hard so he often has to hire day laborers to help him harvest.  Ovidio also works as a laborer on other fields.  “Community work is mutually supportive and we all help each other out,” he mentions.  He also own animals like cows that produce milk which his wife sells in their location.  This is how he supports his family hoping that they have everything they need.  

Ovidio is currently happy with his work because it’s what he enjoys doing.  This will be his 11th loan from MFP so he commits to be punctual with his monthly installment payments.  “Río Blanco” is the name of his communal bank and he mentions that he feels comfortable and satisfied with his fellow members because they all have the same interest in making progress.  He will invest the money in the purchase of two sacks of pea seeds.  Each one costs 600 soles and contains 25 kilos which is what Ovidio needs to start another planting.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of pea seeds.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en: Milka is 35 years old, married and blessed with three children who range in age from eight months to 16 years old. She earns a living by selling old motor vehicle spare parts, a business she started five years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES. 15,000. She has requested for a loan for KES 30,000 to buy used motor vehicle spare parts to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to provide basic needs her family. She hopes to continue with her business and educate her children. This is her first loan

loans.use: to buy used motor vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Ruth Isabel

texts.es:
Ruth Isabel tiene 26 años de edad, es casada hace 9 años y su esposo hace 4 años vive en Estados Unidos y trabaja en aquel país desempeñando trabajos de soldadura, tiene una hija de 8 años de edad y cursa el tercer año en la escuela de su comunidad, vive con ella en la Aldea Santa Elena de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
La actividad económica de Ruth que le ha generado ingresos desde hace dos  años es un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería. Inicio su negocio debido a la falta de empleo y con la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos que le ayudaran a solventar los gastos de su hogar. Y también poder facilitarle a su esposo una ayuda económica extra para su familia. Ella ofrece su mercadería de manera ambulante Ropa Nueva  y calzado tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Considera que este negocio es muy rentable y le ha ido muy bien. Es una mujer que le pone mucho empeño a su negocio dedicándole 4 horas diarias y el resto del tiempo lo dedica hacer ama de casa y al cuidado de su hija.
Ella expone que con el préstamo que solicito de 10,000 lempiras solventara las compras de mercadería como Ropa Nueva y Zapatos de Damas, caballeros y niños como otros productos que no tiene y que los clientes demandan. 
Su meta es seguir trabajando para  poder tener un local estable donde poder vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Ruth Isabel is 26 years old and has been married for nine years. Her husband has been living in the United States the past four years and earns his living as a welder. Ruth has an eight-year-old daughter who is starting her third year of school in her community. She lives in the neighborhood of Santa Elena de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

For the past two years, Ruth has generated income by operating a business of buying and selling merchandise. She started this business because she did not have a job and needed to earn money to help pay for the household expenses. In addition, she would help her husband by providing an extra source of income for their family. Ruth offers her merchandise as a traveling vendor including new clothing and shoes for women, men, and children. She considers her business to be very profitable since she has done very well. Ruth is a woman who invests a great amount of effort into her business. She dedicates four hours a day and then spends the rest of her time as a homemaker and caretaker of her daughter.

Ruth indicates that the loan of 10,000 HNL that she requested will allow her to buy merchandise such as new clothing and shoes for women, men, and children as well as other products that she does not have in stock and are requested by her customers. Her goal is to continue working so that she can open a permanent store where she can sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy new clothing and shoes for women, men, and children.

location.town: Colonia Santa Elena, Santa Cruz de Yojoa

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en: Clementina is a 45-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children who range in age from 30 to 21 years old. One of her children is still in school. For the last three years, she has earned a living by running a mixed food store. She has no employees. Clementina heard about Finance Sudan through the promotion done in the market by our loan officers as well from a radio advertisement. She is requesting a loan for SDG 2,500 to buy more items to sell, such as milk, cold drinks, sugar and many others. In addition to this business, Clementina has no other source of income. In five years, she would like to build a house and buy a motorcycle. Her major challenges are a low income and frequent changes in prices in the wholesale market. Clementina says that she appreciates Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: La señora Juana , es habitante del  municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo , ella está muy contenta por el apoyo que le han brindado durante dos ciclos , ya que los préstamos otorgados los a dirigido para la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar su humilde vivienda , ella desde hace varios años labora para empresa privada , pero su sueldo no le permite comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción , lo cual tiene como meta para este 2012  realizar un anexo en la parte trasera de la vivienda ; ya que este el préstamo será utilizado para  comprar , bloques , cemento , arena , piedrín , entre otros .
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe, where she lives with her husband. She is very pleased with the support she has received during the last two loan cycles. The loans that have been provided were used to buy construction materials for improving her modest home. For the past several years, she has worked for a private company, but her salary does not allow her to make a one-time purchase of construction materials.

Her goal for 2012 is to complete an annex at the back of her house. Therefore, this loan will be used to buy blocks, cement, sand, gravel, and other materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Chicas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Chicas trabajadoras son un grupo de 7 personas que viven en una colonia ubicada en la ciudad de Monterrey. Son Amigas desde hace muchos años, por lo cual se conocen muy bien y dicen ser mujeres muy trabajadoras (como su nombre lo dice), además de la confianza tan grade que existe entre ellas.
Graciela es una de ellas, una mujer muy seria y responsable, tiene un puesto de herramientas usadas el cual junto con su esposo iniciaron con poca mercancía; con el tiempo su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco y ya tiene mas variedad de productos y con ayuda del crédito podrá comprar mas herramientas usadas además de invertir en otros productos como colchas para vender en su casa. Su sueño es seguir creciendo con su negocio para lograr cubrir los gastos en su hogar y poder vivir mas tranquila.
texts.en:
“Chicas Trabajadoras” (Hard-Working Girls) is a group of seven people who live in a neighborhood in the city of Monterrey.  They have been friends for many years, so they know each other very well.  They say that they are very hard-working women (as their name says) in addition to the huge amount of trust that exists between them.

Graciela is one of them.  She is a very serious and responsible woman.  She has a small used tool stand that she and her husband started with little merchandise.  In time their business has been gradually growing.  

She now has a greater variety of products, and with help from the loan she will be able to buy more used tools.  She will also invest in other products like comforters to sell at her house.

Her dream is to continue growing with her business in order to cover the household expenses and to be able to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy more tools and comforters to sell.

loans.name: Pricila

texts.es:
Pricila tiene 64 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 35 y 26 años los dos son mayores y vive con ellos en la Colonia Bella Vista de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

La actividad económica que le genera ingresos a Doña Pricila es un negocio de una pequeña pulpería en donde vende productos de la canasta básica como (azúcar, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, harina además ofrece también  galletas, churros, refrescos, condimentos, etc.). Comenzó su negocio desde hace 25 años con la necesidad de darles a sus hijos el sustento diario. Ahora sus hijos son mayores y le ayudan en los gastos del hogar. Ha logrado mantener su negocio con mucho esfuerzo y por medio de financiamientos que ha obtenido le han ayudado a  invertir en su negocio.

En la actualidad esta solicitando un préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para abastecerse de granos básicos, churros, galletas, refrescos. Y así poder aumentar su inventario logrando dar un mejor servicio de productos que demandan los clientes.
Su meta es que con la inversión hecha sus ventas aumenten más.
texts.en:
Pricila is 64 years old and a single mother. She has two children, ages 35 and 26, who are grown. They live with her in Colonia Bella Vista de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Doña Pricila generates income by managing a small grocery business where she sells basic household products such as sugar, rice, beans, and flour. In addition, she offers cookies, fried dough, soft drinks, condiments, and other products. She started this business 25 years ago so that she could provide for the daily needs of her children. Now that her children are grown, they help with the household expenses. Pricila has maintained her business with great effort and the loans that she has obtained have helped her to invest in her business.

She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that she can restock with basic grains, fried dough, cookies, and soft drinks. As a result, she will be able to increase her inventory and provide better service, as well as offer products demanded by her customers. Her goal is to increase her sales through this investment.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, flour, rice, lard, sugar, beans, eggs, fried dough, cookies, and soft drinks.

location.town: Colonia Bella Vista, Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es: Aquilina de 40 años, es una mujer seria. Vive en compañía de Eliazar, su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Kelvin y Lizbeth, a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Cajas. Mientras que su esposo trabaja como peón en una fábrica de ladrillos, donde la pagan por cada millar que realiza. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, pues es ahí donde obtiene mejores ganancias. Su trabajo consiste en la compra de ovejas, toros y vacas muy pequeños, a quienes cuida y alimenta para luego venderlos en las ferias locales de la ciudad, ya tiene mucho tiempo de experiencia. Cuenta que cotiza muy bien sus reses y si no le pagan lo que solicita los regresa a su casa para seguir alimentándolos y así obtener la próxima vez una mejor ganancia. “no puedo rematar los animales, tengo que ser inteligente”, afirma. Ahora desea junto a su esposo alquilar un terreno amplio para poner su fábrica de ladrillos y así pueda trabajar para algo propio y no para otras personas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi banco” y este es el décimo primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que obtendrá el préstamo que necesita para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son responsables y solidarios. Aquilina de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más animales para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Aquilina, age 40, is a serious woman. She lives with Eliazar, her husband for the past 20 years. They have two children, Kelvin and Lizbeth, who they take care of in their own home in the town of Cajas. Her husband works at a brick factory where he gets paid for each thousand bricks that he produces. Aquilina engages in the purchase and sale of livestock as a way of earning more income. Her work consists of buying young sheep, bulls, and cows that she will care for and feed so that they can be sold later at the local fairs in the city. She has already gained plenty of experience. Aquilina has appraised her cattle to be of high value, so when she does not receive the price that she asked for, she returns home and continues feeding her animals in hopes of getting a higher price next time. "I am not able to auction off the animals, so I have to be intelligent," says Aquilina. She and her husband now want to rent a large piece of land for opening a brick factory. This will allow them to be self-employed and not have to rely on other people.

Aquilina belongs to the Communal Bank "Mi Banco" (My Bank) and this will be her eleventh loan with MFP. She is grateful for everyone's support because she needs this loan to accomplish her goals. In addition, she promises to be punctual with her loan payments. The members of her Communal bank are responsible and supportive. Upon receiving her loan, Aquilina will invest the money she requested in the purchase of more animals to increase her herd of livestock.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Robila

texts.es:
Robila de 38 años, convive con Víctor con quien tiene 3 hijos: Ana de 16, Víctor de 6 y Yolita de 4 años de edad. Toda esta familia vive en una casa propia en el distrito de Tapo, provincia de Tarma. Robila se dedica a la agricultura. Cuenta con terrenos propios en los que siembra papas, arvejas y habas. “Cada año siembro 35 sacos de semillas de papa y me va bien en las ventas”, menciona. Además afirma que es una de las pobladoras que siembra la mayor cantidad de arvejas en su localidad, con 7 sacos de semillas de arvejas, ya que la mayoría de agricultores produce de 2 a 4 normalmente. Esto se lo debe a su arduo trabajo en casi 20 años.
Al inicio no fue fácil, tuvo que sufrir para tener lo que ahora tiene. La falta de capital fue uno de sus inconvenientes, pero gracias al trabajo con MFP y su esfuerzo propio pudo adquirir su casa y un auto, que Víctor, su esposo, maneja ofreciendo servicios de transporte.
Una de sus metas es ampliar su producción para luego mudarse a la ciudad de Tarma ya que su hijo mayor necesita estudiar una carrera profesional o técnica. Éste sería su crédito número 11 que obtendría de MFP, gracias a su ayuda, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Su banco comunal se llama “Río Blanco”, y se siente contenta de ser parte de este grupo sólido y solidario.
De recibir el dinero podrá comprar 3 bolsas de semillas de arvejas para iniciar otra siembra para el mes de julio.
texts.en:
Robila, 38, lives with Víctor with whom she has three children: Ana, 16, Víctor, 6 and Yolita, 4. The entire family lives in a house of their own in Tapo District, Tarma Province.  

Robila is a farmer.  She owns land where she grows potatoes, peas and lima beans.  “Each year I plant 35 sacks of potato seeds and I do well with my sales,” she mentions.  Besides, she affirms that she’s one of the residents in her location that grows the largest amount of peas.  She produces 7 sacks of pea seeds and most farmers produce between 2 to 4 normally.  This is due to her hard work for almost 20 years.

At the beginning it wasn’t easy; she had to suffer to obtain what she now has.  The lack of capital was one of her obstacles but thanks to work with MFP and her own efforts she was able to acquire a house and a car that Víctor, her husband, drives providing transportation services.

One of her goals is to expand production so that later she can move to the city of Tarma because her oldest son needs to study a professional or technical career.  This will be loan #11 from MFP thanks to your help which is why she commits to be punctual with her monthly installment payments.  

Her communal bank is called “Río Blanco” and she feels happy to be part of solid, mutually supportive group.  If she were to receive the money, she’ll be able to buy three sacks of pea seeds to start another planting in July.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of pea seeds.

loans.name: Mari

texts.es:
Mari de 39 años, convive con Miguel de 43 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 9 años. Toda esta unida famita vive en el distrito de Tapo, provincia de Tarma. Mari demuestra fortaleza al momento de dedicarse a la actividad que le brinda lo necesario para mantener a su familia. Ella se dedica a la agricultura, en sus terrenos propios de cultivos y en otros que arrienda siembra papas, maíz y arvejas. 
Menciona que la comercialización de sus productos es rentable, pero antes debe invertir en la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, y en el pago de personal operario.
Su esposo la ayuda en el trabajo duro, pero ella no se queda a tras y también coge las herramientas para cultivar sus plantaciones.
Así también cuenta con 2 vacas que le proporcionan leche. Así elabora quesos y los vende en su propia localidad.
Uno de sus objetivos más cercanos es ampliar su producción para eso deberá arrendar terrenos, de esa manera quiere brindarle a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida. Gracias a la recomendación de sus compañeras, Mari accedería a su primer crédito de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Está entusiasmada de formar parte del grupo “Santa Cruz de Tapo”, por el trabajo solidario que realizan. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos para sus cultivos de papas que piensa cosechar en el mes de mayo.
texts.en:
39-year-old Mari lives with her partner Miguel who is 43.  The couple have two children who are 12 and 9 years old.  This united family lives in Tapo district, in Tarma province.  Mari displays her strength when she carries out the work which provides her with what she needs to support her family.  She is a farmer and grows potatoes, corn and peas on her own farmland and on additional land which she rents.

Mari says that selling her crops is profitable but first she must invest in buying manure, fertilizers and seeds, and pay workers.  Her husband helps her with the hard labor but she doesn't stand idly by.  She also grabs the tools and works on the land.  In addition, Mari has two cows that provide her with milk.  She makes cheese with the milk and sells it in her own town.

One of Mari's next goals is to expand her production.  In order to do this she will need to rent more land.  In this way, she hopes to provide her children with a good quality of life.  Thanks to the recommendation of her friends, Mari will be taking out her first loan with MFP and she gives her word that she will make her monthly repayments on time.  She is enthusiastic about belonging to her group (Santa Cruz de Tapo) owing to the supportive work that they do.  She will invest her loan money in buying sacks of organic fertilizers for her potato crops which she plans to harvest in May.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
Lenah is a mother of six children, all adults, between the ages of 30 and 18, with the last two still undergoing their post-secondary education. She is 53 years old and has been active in farming for 10 years. Her farm produces maize and beans, which she sells to the local market. She is a teacher by profession.

Lenah has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her purchase poultry birds at 20,000 KES and build a poultry housing unit at 30,000 KES. She says her decision to venture into poultry farming was influenced by the existence of a ready market for poultry products. She hopes to maintain a farm of more than 2,000 birds.

Lenah says her major challenges in the farming business are animal diseases. She adds that the existing markets, too, are not well-organized.

loans.use: To build a poultry housing unit and to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, age 47, is a resident of Kitale. She has been in farming for seven years, producing and selling milk and eggs to the local market. This provides her with the income her family fully relies on. She is married and has six children between the ages of 25 and 5, with the last four still in school.

Grace has requested a loan of 41,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow at 31,200 KES and construct a dairy unit at 10,000 KES. She says her focus is to first repay the loan and educate her children, and then to use the extra income to expand her business. She aspires to have five dairy cows.

She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services but adds that the major challenge in poultry and dairy farming remains the rampant occurrence of diseases, which are costly to manage.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna de 53 años, convive con Pedro. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero vive con uno de ellos, Jhon, en una casa propia en el distrito de Tapo – Tarma. Reyna es una mujer como pocas, luchadora y emprendedora. Empezó sus actividades con la agricultura. Paralelamente vendía verduras, esto hace 30 años atrás. Cuando unió su vida a Pedro se decidió a trabajar con más ahínco ya que los hijos venían en camino. Actualmente se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde adquiere su mercadería. Los días de feria en el mercado de Tarma lleva sus productos y los vende al menudeo. Le va muy bien, pues en todos estos años aprendió a comercializar con inteligencia. Además de vender sus propios sembríos de papa, habas y hortalizas, que cosecha en cada temporada. Asimismo se dedica a la crianza de 10 vacas que tiene con lo que realiza queso, un promedio de 7 a 6 moldes diarios. También a la crianza de 15 carneros los cuales enseba y lleva a venderlos a los carniceros y pobladores de la localidad.  Sus hijos mayores la ayudan en el trabajo pesado de la agricultura. Así Reyna y Pedro viven en armonía con la mentalidad de seguir creciendo. Éste sería su crédito número 10 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Se siente contenta de pertenecer tantos años a un banco comunal de personas responsables y solidarias.
Invertirá el dinero del préstamo en la compra de verduras la por mayor como: espinacas, lechugas, zanahorias, papas, etc., que comercializará en el mercado de Tarma.
texts.en:
Reyna, 53, lives with Pedro; they have 8 children but only one of them, Jhon, lives with them in their own house in Tapo District, Tarma.  

Reyna is a woman like few others: tenacious and enterprising.  She started working as a farmer and also sold vegetables; this was 30 years ago.  When she joined her life to Pedro she decided to work still harder since children were on the way.  Currently she rises very early to head out to the Tarma wholesale market to acquire her merchandise.  On market days in Tarma she takes her goods to sell at retail.  She does very well because she’s learned how to sell intelligently over the years.  Besides she sells her own potato, lima bean and vegetable crops that she harvests each season.  In addition, she raises 15 calves that she fattens up and then sells to local butchers and residents.  Her older children help her with the heavy farm chores.  Thus do Reyna and Pedro live in harmony with the idea of continuing to grow.

This will be loan #10 that she’ll get from MFP so she commits to be punctual with her monthly installment payments.  She feels happy to belong for so many years to a communal bank made up of responsible, mutually supportive people.

She will use the loan to buy vegetables at wholesale like spinach, lettuce, carrots, potatoes, etc. to sell at the Tarma market.

loans.use: to buy spinach, lettuce, carrots and potatoes.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 42 años, una mujer muy alegre y empeñosa, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 02 queridas hijas, Cruck de 25 años y Nayme de 21 años a quienes desea un buen bienestar. Carmen, es una mujer hogareña se dedica al cuidado de sus hijas y del trabajo que hace 15 años logro conseguir gracias a su esfuerzo por sobresalir en la vida; ella, labora vendiendo repuestos de vehículos y motos; siempre esta al tanto de mantener conforme a sus clientes por los buenos tratos que brinda. A inicios le resultaba muy difícil porque no contaba con suficientes presupuesto, ni estantes donde pueda exponer materiales de venta. Desde que empezó a solicitar los préstamos que realiza MFP; pues ahora le va muy bien con sus ventas. Con el tiempo desea hacer crecer su negocio porque gracias su empeño de este trabajo puede solventar con los gastos de sus hijas y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Este será su crédito número 12 con MFP y se compromete a seguir siendo puntual con sus cuotas de pago como en anteriores préstamos. Asimismo agradece a su banco comunal por ser socias responsables y trabajadoras. Con el préstamo solicitado proporcionará de repuestos de transportes para su tienda.
texts.en:
42-year-old Carmen is a very cheerful and determined woman who lives in her own home together with her two beloved daughters, 25-year-old Cruck and 21-year-old Nayme whose well-being she provides for.  Carmen is a home-loving woman who takes care of her daughters and her business which she managed to establish 15 years ago thanks to her efforts to do well in life.  Carmen works selling spare parts for vehicles and motorcycles.  She is always looking to keep her customers happy through her good service.  At first it was very difficult because she didn't have a large enough budget or any shelves on which to display the products she sold.  However, since she started requesting loans from MFP, her sales are doing very well.  Over time she would like to grow her business because, thanks to her determination in her work, she is able to cover her daughters' expenses and enjoy a better quality of life.

This will be Carmen's 12th loan from MFP and she pledges to continue making her repayments on time as she has with her previous loans.  She is grateful to the members of her community bank for being responsible and hard-working.  Carmen will use the loan she has requested to stock her store with spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, de 33 años, es una mujer audaz y laboriosa, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo y sus  tres queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La peluquería de la señora Gloria es muy concurrida por gente que transita su calle, su puesto esta ubicada en su propia casa donde brinda una buena atención para sus clientes quienes se retiran muy contentos por el trabajo de Gloria; esta actividad lo realiza hace 15 años y lo hace con la ayuda de su esposo; ambos realizan cortes y peinados; de esta forma logran tener un buen sustento económico para su hogar. Con el crédito solicitado incrementará lo necesario para su salón  ya le hace falta algunas cosas por incrementar como por ejemplo sillones para dar más comidada a sus clientesd, tijeras de todo tipo, entre otras necesidades que le ayuden a cumplir con su trabajo. Este será su crédito número 12 con MFP, por ello una vez mas espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar su trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia participativa y solidaria.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará los materiales necesarios para su negocio de peluquería.
texts.en:
33-year-old Gloria is a courageous and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and her three beloved children who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.  Gloria's hairdressing salon is very busy with passersby.  Her salon is located in her own home and here she provides her customers with a good service and they leave very happy with her work.  She has been in this business for 15 years and she works with her husband's help.  The couple both provide haircuts and hairdos.  In this way, they manage to provide financially for their household.  Gloria will use the loan she has requested to buy essential items for her salon as she lacks some things she needs for her business to grow.  For example, she needs chairs so that she can make her customers more comfortable, all kinds of scissors and other items which will help her to carry out her work.

This will be Gloria's 12th loan from MFP and she once again hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can carry out her work.  She is an active and supportive member of her community bank.  Gloria will use her 1,500 soles to buy materials she needs for her hairdressing business.

loans.use: to buy materials and furniture for her hairdressing salon

loans.name: Wastaarabu Group

texts.en:
Hidaya, who is in her early 30s, is married and has two children who go to school. She has been selling charcoal and chapati (flat bread) in the same place for two years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Hidaya's ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy land, begin building her house, help her husband pay for household expenses and increase her charcoal stock. Additionally, she started making and selling chapati. She has paid back all her loans successfully. 

Hidaya requests a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and to buy 10 kilos of baking flour so she can make more chapatis to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her own house.

Hidaya will share this loan with her loan group "Wastaarabu" which has a total of 20 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and to buy 10 kilos of baking flour so she can make more chapati (flat bread) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Duo El Cariño Group

texts.es:
Duo el cariño.
este duo esta integrado por doña Elvia de 43 años de edad,tiene 3 hijos a su cargo y dos todavia estudian, ella se dedica a la elavoracion de ropa de bebe de forma ambulante yeba ya 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad,tambien ella saca pedidos de sus clientes cuando le encargan,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elavoracion de ropa de bebe,al igual que el siguiente socio quien es Elder de 21 años de edad,el se dedica a la venta de ponchos,sabanas,de forma ambulante, el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas producto para su venta y de la misma forma aumentar su capital para seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Duo: “El Cariño”

This duo is composed of Elvia, 43, who has three children in her care; two are still in school.  She makes clothes for babies in an itinerant manner; she’s been in this activity for ten years.  She takes orders from customers who request items.  She’s asking for the loan to buy raw materials to make clothes for infants.

The other member is Elder, 21, who sells ponchos and sheets in an ambulatory manner.  He’s asking for the loan to buy more merchandise to sell and to increase capital to continue with his business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make baby clothes.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty de 26 años, vive con su esposo Noe desde hace 7 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Zaraí de 9 y Jesús de 4 años. Está familia habita un casa propia en el distrito de tapo, provincia de Tarma. Betty es una mujer agricultora. Cuando tenía 20 empezó con esta actividad ya que las necesidades económicas llegaban conforme sus hijos crecían. Es así que se dedica  a la siembra de papa, maíz y arveja. Sus conocimientos los debe a sus padres quienes le enseñaron a cultivar la tierra. Gracias a su esfuerzo y la ayuda que hace muchos años MFP le brinda pudo construir su casa, así pudo darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños hijos.
Así también comenta que el año pasado comenzó a trabajar como promotora de salud en su comunidad, atendiendo a los niños desnutridos. Por lo que le pagan un dinero extra. Asimismo comparte sus actividades con la ganadería, cuidando de sus animales menores como: cerdos, burros y carneros, que luego de ensebarlos los llevan a comercializarlos en el mercado central de la ciudad. Betty en el futuro desea sembrar en mayor  cantidad e independizarse, además tiene planeado abrir una tienda de abarrotes que le ayude a obtener más ingresos económicos. Tiene sus planes claros. Éste sería su crédito número 10 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Afirma sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Tapo”, por tener como compañeros a personas responsables.
Betty, invertirá el dinero en la compra de 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas; con lo restante comprará bolsas de abonos orgánicos, para garantizar el crecimiento de su reciente siembra.
texts.en:
Betty, 26, has been living with her husband, Noé, for the last 7 years.  They both have two children: Zaraí, 9, and Jesús, 4.  This family lives in a house of their own in Tapo District, Tarma Province.

Betty is a farmer.  When she was twenty years old she started this activity because economic need increased as her children grew.  She grows potatoes, corn and peas.  She owes her knowledge to her parents who taught her to farm the land.  Thanks to her efforts and help from MFP for many years she built her house and was able to give her small children a better quality of life.

She also comments that last year she started working as a health promoter in her community tending to undernourished children for which she’s paid an extra salary.  In addition, she shares her activities with raising livestock caring for small animals like pigs, donkeys and calves which once fattened up are sold in the city’s central market.

In the future Betty would like to plant larger amounts and become independent.  She also plans to open a grocery store that will help her earn more income.  She has clear-cut plans.

This would be loan #10 from MFP so she commits to be punctual with her monthly installment payments.  She affirms that she feels comfortable in her “Santa Cruz de Tapo” communal bank because she has responsible people as fellow members.

Betty will invest the money in the purchase of two sacks of pea seeds and will use the remainder to buy sacks of organic manure to insure the growth of her recent planting.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of pea seeds and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Por Un Futuro Mejor (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Por un Futuro Mejor está formado por 10 socias y 1 socio quienes laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias.

Nuestras socias al igual que toda la gente de Paute se caracterizan por mantener la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven en el cantón de Paute que se encuentra ubicado al noreste de la provincia del Azuay,  tiene un clima sub-tropical-templado y está rodeado por muchas elevaciones. Las labores agrícolas ocupan gran parte de la mano de obra y se complementa esta actividad con la ganadería en poca escala. En la zona de Paute se asientan algunas empresas dedicadas a la exportación de flores, otra fuente de trabajo es la producción de aguardiente y la manufactura de muebles. Son muy afamadas las bordadoras de Chicán, cuenta con varios lugares para visitar.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ruth, tiene 33 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad  que están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es empleado privado, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Ruth  tiene un bazar y papelería hace 8 años, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de artículos de bazar y útiles escolares para su negocio.
 
Su meta es agrandar su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia
texts.en:
The 'Por un Futuro Mejor' community bank is made up of 10 women and 1 man who work every day in different business activities that allow them to cover their household expenses and provide for their families.

Our members, in common with everybody else in Paute, are noted for the fact that they maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.  They live in Paute canton which is in the north-east of Azuay province.  This area has a sub-tropical temperate climate and is surrounded by many hills.  Most of the workers in this area are employed in agriculture and this is complemented with some small-scale livestock raising.  In Paute there are some companies whose business is exporting flowers.  Other sources of work are liquor production and furniture making.  The Chicán embroiderers are very well known and there are a few places to visit. 

One of the members of this group is Ruth.  Ruth is 33 years old, married, and has two children from her marriage who are 7 and 5 years old.  They are attending an elementary school in the town.  Her husband is a private employee and they own their own home.

Ruth has been running a stationery store for eight years.  She works from Sunday to Sunday, from 8 in the morning until 8 at night.

This is Ruth's first loan through her community bank which she was invited to join by a friend.  She will invest her loan money in buying stationery products and school supplies for her business.

Ruth's goal is to expand her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy stationery products and school supplies

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 33 years old, married, and blessed with four children aged 11, 7, 5, and 1 year respectively. He has been in the transport business locally known as a “boda boda” (a motorcycle fitted with a tailor-made seat over the rear wheel for transporting passengers). He started the business a year ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 24,000. 

He has requested a loan worth KES 22,000 to buy another motorcycle. The profit he makes would help him pay school fees for his children. 

His dream is to educate his children to greater levels. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 26-year-old businessman. He is married to Susan, a business lady. They are blessed with two children, aged five years and one year respectively.

He has been selling second-hand clothes for the past nine months. He earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by KADET staff. Francis will use the loan to buy a stock of clothes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan is 25 years old. He lives in Gndevaz village with his parents and sister. Vahan works at the local school as a teacher. He is also involved in agriculture. Vahan runs a farm, where he breeds cows, sheep, and hens. 

Vahan is a very hardworking and purposeful person, and to these qualities he has expanded the farm during past few years. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to increase the number of cows. Vahan expects an increase of income, which is important for him to cover the family's daily costs and meet their needs.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

location.town: Gndevaz village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Janiffer

texts.en:
Janiffer is a 43-year-old businesswoman. She is a single mother of one child aged 13 years. She has been running a greengrocer business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 6,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Janiffer will use the loan to buy assorted vegetables and fruits to sell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hope and dream is to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Weedor

texts.en: Weedor is 33 years old and lives in Buchanan, Liberia. She is married and has a child aged 12 years old that is attending school and lives at home. For three years now she has been selling  rice, oil, pepper, and many items. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, pepper, and many items for her business. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper, and many items for her business

loans.name: Mari Cruz

texts.es: Doña Mari Cruz, de 35 años de edad tiene 4 hijos y se dedica a elavorar tortillas,y tambien tiene su restaurante,desde hace 8 años,nos cuenta que esta muy agradecida con Kiva ya que el exito que a alcanzado en su negocio es por ellos,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz, y mercaderia para elavorar comidas,ya que sus clientes han aumentado y nececita mas capital para trabajar,y asi agrandar mas su megocio.
texts.en: Mari Cruz, 35, has four children.  She makes tortillas and also has had a restaurant for the last 8 years.  She comments that she’s very grateful to Kiva because the success she’s attained in her business is thanks to them.  She’s asking for this loan to buy corn and supplies to prepare food since her clientele has increased and she needs more working capital to enlarge her business more.

loans.use: to buy corn and supplies to make food.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, es una mujer de lucro, tiene 42 años y gracias a su gran esfuerzo tiene su propia casa de material noble donde vive con sus 02 queridas hijas, Yanina de 21 y Yuli de 16 años a quienes brinda mucha dedicación. Gracias a su perseverancia y sobre todo al esfuerzo que tiene, logró comprar una maquina de peladora de arroz; hace 20 años que se dedica en esta actividad y para ella, le es muy sencillo realizar esta labor ya que esa lo que mas le gusta. Sus principales clientes son gente campesina de su localidad que se dedican a la siembra de arroz y en los tiempos de cosecha pues llevan al centro de trabajo de Elizabeth para que pueda pelar sacos de arroz. Normalmente lo hace sola pero tuvo que contratar a un peón para que lo apoye en cargar los sacos de grano que la gente acumula. Con el tiempo desea en poder agrandar su negocio ya que es el sustento para su familia sobre todo para la educación de sus hijas. Ahora lo que prioriza es culminar con la fachada de su vivienda ya que falta remodelarla haciendo el pintado correspondiente. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP, por tanto agradece por la colaboración para continuar con sus planes de trabajo. Asimismo se compromete a seguir siendo puntual con sus cuotas de pago. En su banco comunal es una socia solidaria.
Con el préstamo solicitado de 1,000 nuevos soles comprará cemento para el acabado de su casa.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a successful woman.  She is 42 years old and, thanks to her hard work, she owns her own home which is made from solid building materials.  She lives here with her two beloved daughters, 21-year-old Yanina and 16-year-old Yuli, who she is devoted to.  Thanks to her perseverance and, above all, the hard work she does, Elizabeth managed to buy a rice-hulling machine.  She has been in this business for 20 years now and it is very easy for her to carry out her work as she really enjoys it.  Her main customers are people from her town who grow rice.  At harvest time they bring their crops to Elizabeth's workplace so that she can hull their sacks of rice.  Elizabeth normally works alone but she had to hire a laborer to support her in filling the grain sacks that mount up.  Over time, she would like to be able to expand her business as it is how she provides for her family, especially for her daughters' education.  Right now, her priority is to finish work on the outside of her house as she needs to refurbish it with some paint.  

This will be Elizabeth's third loan from MFP and she is grateful for your cooperation which will allow her to continue carrying out her plans.  She pledges to continue making her repayments on time.  Elizabeth is a supportive member of her community bank.  She will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy cement so that she can finish off her house.

loans.use: to buy cement so that she can finish building her house

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 49 years old and lives in Buchanan along with her husband and four children, who are between the ages of 9 and 18. She has been selling soap for the past four years. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap for her business. 

She hopes to be an owner of a house and to take care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soap for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has been in the clothes-selling business in Nakuru town, Kenya, for the last four years. She is 35 years old and married to Raymond, and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of clothes for sale in her shop to meet her clients' needs as well as the high demand.

In the future, she plans to open a big boutique and sell all kinds of clothes, thereby making more income and improving her family's living standards. From the income she also hopes to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Morinke

texts.en:
Morinke, aged 45, is married to Selina, and they are blessed with four children aged between five and 15 years. He sells livestock and has been doing this for five years. The business gives him a monthly income of KES 20,000.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy a cow and three goats for resale. Morinke intends to use the anticipated profits to buy a plot and hopes to build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and three goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, de 42 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, además de ser amable y caballeroso. Es conviviente con Juliana quien es ama de casa y madre de sus 3 hijos: Juan, Ami y Frank de 6, 2 y 1 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos viven en su propia casa que compraron con sus ahorros. La actividad que realiza Francisco es el servicio de soldadura, oficio que aprendió de manera empírica cuando trabajaba como ayudante en un taller de soldadura. Ahora trabaja en el  taller de un amigo y gana por porcentaje por trabajo acabado. 
Se inició en ese negocio hace más de 7 años y hasta el momento lo realiza en el taller de su amigo.
Antes trabajaba de vendedor de pescado al cual consideró pesado y decidió cambiarse a soldadura viendo mayores ganancias. 
Considera su actividad bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y el poco tiempo que le toma realizarlo. Antes de empezar con su actividad tenía apuros económicos pues el anterior negocio no le resultaba y lo consideraba pesado, muchas veces pasando necesidad con su familia. 
Pero ahora con su oficio tiene mejores ganancias, con las cuales desea compra un carrito freidor de papas para la venta de comidas rápidas en la que atenderá su pareja, así ambos se apoyaran con los gastos del hogar, buscando progresar. Este será el préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP. Está contento y agradecido de saber que seguirá contando con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera a sus integrantes ser personas  buenas y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 1800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de un carrito freidor de papas para un nuevo negocio para su pareja,  valorizado en 780 nuevos soles, y con el saldo los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
42-year-old Francisco is a hard-working and determined man.  He is also kind and chivalrous.  He lives with his partner Juliana who is a housewife and the mother of his three children Juan, Ami and Frank, who are 6, 2 and 1.  They live together in their own home that they bought with their savings.

Francisco works as a welder, a trade that he learned on the job when he used to work as an assistant in somebody else's metal shop.  Now he works in a friend's workshop and earns a percentage for the work that he does.  He started out in this business more than seven years ago and, up to now, he has worked in his friend's workshop.  He previously worked as a fish seller which he considered to be hard work.  He decided to change to welding because he saw that it made more profits.  He considers his work to be fairy profitable.  It makes him good money and doesn't take him much time to do.  Before he started out in this business he was experiencing financial difficulties as his previous business did not provide him with good results and he considered it hard going.  He often failed to provide for his family's needs.  However, with his new trade he is now making better profits.  He would like to use them to buy a fast food cart which his partner will work on selling fast food.  In this way, the couple will support each other in covering their household expenses and will both look to make progress.

This will be Francisco's eighth loan from MFP.  He is happy and grateful to know that he will continue having a line of credit so that he can make progress in his business.  He feels very comfortable with his community bank as he considers its members to be nice, supportive people.  Francisco will invest the sum of 1,800 soles that he has requested in buying a fast food cart so that he can establish a new business for his partner.  The cart is worth 780 soles.  He will use the remainder of the money to buy the ingredients needed to prepare fast food.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart and ingredients for preparing fast food

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a bundle of second-hand toys.

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Carmen Isabel tiene 56 años de edad, es casada su esposo es comerciante l, tiene 4 hijos de 37, 35,30 y 24 años todos son independientes y 3 viven aparte y uno vive en sus casa en el Barrio Lempira, Tela, Atlántida.
Ella se dedica desde hace 31 años ha atender su propio negocio de pulpería en donde vende Productos como medicamentos, embutidos, carne de pollo, productos de la canasta básica como, (manteca, harina, arroz, frijoles etc.). Este negocio le ha ayudado mucho porque es un ingreso extra que aporta para el hogar. Ella es una señora muy trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar su pequeña pulpería adelante trabajando todo el día en ella.
Es su primer préstamo con ODEF de 10,000 lempiras, que lo necesita para poder invertir en la compra de productos de la canasta básica, Como Azucar, manteca, harina, refrescos etc. Para poder ofrecerle mas producto a los clientes.
Su meta es seguir vendiendo en el negocio para lograr a obtener los ingresos necesarios para el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Carmen Isabel, 56, is married; her husband’s a merchant.  She has four children who are 37, 35, 30, and 24 years old; they are all independent.  Three live on their own and one still at home in Barrio Lempira in Tela, Atlántida.

For the last 31 years she’s been tending to her own grocery store.  She sells products like medicine, cured meats, chicken and basic staple items like lard, flour, rice, beans, etc.  The business has helped her a lot because it’s an additional source of income for her home.  She’s a very hardworking woman who with much effort has managed to move her small grocery store forward by working in it all day.

This is her first loan with ODEF.  It’s for 10,000 lempiras that she needs to invest in the purchase of basic staple items like sugar, lard, flour, soft-drinks, etc. to offer more products to her customers.  Her goal is to continue selling in the store to obtain income necessary for her daily sustenance.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items (sugar, lard, flour, soft-drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana tiene 66 años de edad, es casada hace 48 años y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene dos hijos mayores de 46 y 40 años  que ya son independientes y viven aparte, ella solo vive con su esposo en el Barrio las Brisas de Peña Blanca Cortes.
A Doña Juana siempre le ha gustado costurar aprendió desde muy joven, ella confecciona cortinas, cameras y ropa de todo tipo para la venta. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a ejercer esta actividad la cual es la que le genera los ingresos para vivir mejor que antes. Inicio este negocio con el afán de poder ayudar a su esposo con  los gastos, y poder sacar sus hijos adelante. Y cuenta con mucha demanda de clientes y trabaja 9 horas diarias.
Doña Juana ha obtenido financiamientos con ODEF que le han ayudado en la superación en su negocio, actualmente ella solicita su segundo préstamo por la cantidad de 7,000 lempiras para compra de telas para la elaboración de sus prendas de vestir para seguir vendiendo y mejorar sus ingresos.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para reinvertir sus ganancias en seguir comprando  materia prima (telas), para la elaboración de sus prendas. Para seguir obteniendo una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Juana is 66 years old, married for 48 years, and her husband’s a farmer.  She has two adult children who are 46 and 40 years old and are now independent living on their own.  She lives just with her husband in Barrio las Brisas in Peña Blanca, Cortes.

Juana has always enjoyed sewing which she learned while still very young; she sews curtains, bedspreads and all sorts of clothes to sell.  She’s been in this activity for twenty years and it generates income that allows her to live better now than before.  She started the business hoping to help her husband with expenses and to raise her children.  She has much customer demand and works nine hours daily.

Juana has gotten ODEF loans that have helped her succeed in business.  Currently she’s asking for a 7,000 lempira loan to buy fabric to make clothes to continue selling and improving her income.  Her goal is to continue working to reinvest her profits in the purchase of more raw materials (fabric) to make articles of clothing and continue obtaining better economic solvency.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

location.town: Barrio las Brisas, Peña Blanca, Cortes.

loans.name: María Judith

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Su Bankito.

En este lugar  vive la señora María, tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de una relación que tuvo hace varios años atrás, ellos a pesar que son mayores de edad aun viven con ella y estudian en la universidad.

Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en un centro de estudios, tiene un taller de costura y un pequeño bazar en su casa, allí además de coser y vender sus propios vestidos también vende toda clase de artículos de bazar, le encanta confeccionar ropa de mujer y también elabora ropa de niños, trabaja todos los días de 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces trabaja hasta más tarde cuando tiene que entregar alguna prenda, lleva más de 15 años en este negocio y es con esto que pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y artículos de bazar. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Su Bankito' community bank meet in La California neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo.  This city is also known as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here we meet 56-year-old Maria who is a single mother and has two children from a relationship that she was involved in years ago.  In spite of the fact that they are adults, her children still live with her and are attending university.

Maria learned how to make clothing in an educational center years ago.  She has a sewing workshop and a small store selling household goods in her home.  There, in addition to sewing and selling her own garments, she also sells all kinds of household goods.  She enjoys making women's clothing and children's clothing.  She works every day, from 8.00am to 8.00pm and sometimes until even later when she has to deliver some garment or other.  

Maria has been in this business for more than 15 years and it is how she has provided for her children.  She will use this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners and household goods.  She has been a member of her community bank for two years and she likes it because of the ease with which she can acquire loans.  Her goals are to make progress in both her business and her personal life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners and household goods

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Su Bankito.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, una es mayor de edad y  otro de 17 años que estudia en colegio y es quien vive con ella.  Su marido es mecánico.
 
Ella es diseñadora de modas ya que estudió en un instituto superior y se graduó de diseñadora en alta costura. Tiene un taller de alta costura en su casa, elabora toda clase de vestidos desde trajes de novias, quinceañeras hasta trajes casuales, a ella le gusta inventar los diseños ya que para eso estudio, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene alguna prenda que entregar, con ella trabajan dos operarias a quienes les paga un sueldo mensual,  tiene dos años  su taller y como le va muy bien está pensando en ampliar el local.

Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la confección de ropa. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y los intereses muy bajos.
 
Su meta es tener el mejor taller de costura de la ciudad.
texts.en:
In the La California neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the communal bank "Su Bankito" meets every 15 days.

Here we meet Maria, 45, who is in a common-law marriage and has 2 children.  One of her children is an adult, and the other, who is 17, is studying in school and lives with her.  Her husband is a mechanic.

Maria is a fashion designer; she studied in a technical college and received a degree in high fashion design.  She has a fashion design workshop in her house where she makes all kinds of garments, from bridal dresses to quinceanera dresses to casual suits. She enjoys inventing the designs, because this is what she studied for.  She works each day from 8am until 6pm, and at times she works later when she has some garments to deliver.  She has two employees who work with her whom she pays a monthly salary.  She has had this workshop for 2 years, and since is going very well she is planning to expand her shop.

She will use this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other supplies for making garments.  She has been with her communal bank for 2 year, and she likes it because she can access loans quickly and at low interest rates.

Maria's goal is to have the best dressmaking shop in the city.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other supplies for making garments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for seeds

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 27-year-old business lady. She is married to Thomas, a business man. They are blessed with two children, who are 9 and 4 years old. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the past five years and earns a monthly income of 18,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Priscilla will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell in her business.

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yelena
