She is married with one daughter.  Her most important dream is to be able to grow a little bit more in her business and improve her family's income.  This is why she wants the loan for her store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, grains, and beverages.

loans.name: Isabel De Jesus

texts.es: Isabel es una mujer de 55 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su mini tienda su historia empezó cuando sus hijos crecieron y se independizaron se puso un negocio, su trabajo lo hace con sus hijos todos los días, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene 4 hijos, su sueño más importante es tener una tienda. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su salón de mini tienda y asi comprar confites, dulces.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 55-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her mini store business over the next few years.

When Isabel's children grew up and became independent she decided to set up a business.  She works with her children every day and doesn't experience any difficulties.  Isabel is not married and has four children.  Her biggest dream is to own a store.  She would like this loan for her mini store so that she can buy snacks and candies.

loans.use: to buy snacks and candies

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su familia en un caserío pequeño de nombre “Saltur”, el lugar es una zona turística donde los pobladores se dedican mayormente a la venta de animales menores y la artesanía, esta ubicado a una hora aproximadamente de la Provincia de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 11 años atrás el se dedica a la venta de animales menores y carne de cerdo en los mercados aledaños a su caserío, cuenta ya con una gran cantidad de clientes quienes realizan sus pedidos con anticipación para lo que Walter recorre los caserío comprando cerdos los cuales engorda y luego comercializa como carne. 

Esta solicitando un crédito a edpyme Alternativa por un monto de  2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales invertirá en la compra de cerdos para con el fin de aumentar sus ventas.
Tiene buenas referencias de parte de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Walter is 48 years old and married.  He lives together with his family in a small village called Saltur.  It is in a tourist area and the locals mainly work selling animals and making handicrafts.  It is approximately one hour from Chiclayo province.

Walter has been selling animals and pork meat in neighboring markets for 11 years.  He already has a large number of customers who place their orders in advance so he goes around the villages buying pigs which he fattens and then later sells as meat.

Walter is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in buying pigs so that he can increase his sales.  He has good references from his customers.

loans.use: to buy animals (pigs)

loans.name: Mario Jesus

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HACIA EL TRIUNFO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Mario Jesus, el socio es músico de profesión, el socio tiene una agrupación musical llamada Aroma, él y su grupo se presentan para amenizar todo tipo de compromisos como matrimonios,bautizos,fiestas de cumpleaños entre otros y tocan todo tipo de canciones como salsa, huaynos, criollas, boleros, vals, tangos, baladas, pop, rock; el socio es una persona bien responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia siendo de esta manersa que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el préstamo para renovar un equipo de musica y parlantes.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo que le otorgaran y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Mario Jesus belongs to the 'Hacia el Triunfo' community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department. Mario Jesus is a musician by profession. He has a band called Aroma and he and his group liven up all kinds of events such as weddings, baptisms, birthday parties, etc. They play all kinds of music such as salsa, huaynos, Creole music, boleros, waltzes, tangos, ballads, pop and rock. He is a very responsible person who has a great desire to make progress for his family's sake. This is how he provides for his family. Mario Jesus is requesting this loan to replace a piece of musical equipment and some speakers. He is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to replace a piece of musical equipment and some speakers

loans.name: Jenniffer Yadira

texts.es: Jennifer es una mujer de 22 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su salón de belleza y peluquería su historia empezó porque me gusta ser estilista pura tener ingresos propios, su trabajo lo hace sola todos los días, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene 1 hija, su sueño más importante es terminar el local en mi casa. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su salón de belleza-peluquería por eso quiere el prestamo para construir mejor su peluqueria comprando cemento, arena, bloques.
texts.en:
Jennifer is a 22-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her beauty salon and hairdressing business over the next few years.

Jennifer started out in this business because she enjoys working as a stylist and making her own income.  She works alone every day and does not experience any difficulties.  She is not married and has one daughter.  Jennifer's biggest dream is to finish building her premises in her home.  She would like this loan for her beauty salon / hairdressing business so that she can improve its construction, buying cement, sand and blocks.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and blocks

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 39 years old and married to Aineah and together they have two children. She operates a detergents and soap-making business. She supplies  neighboring customers and traders in the market.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of chemicals for soap making.

In the future, Emily plans to grow her business and start a soap-making industry, hence becoming one of the leading business people in the region.

loans.use: To add more stock of chemicals for soap making.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is still running his bakery. He bakes and sells bread and lavash and thus provides for his family. 

Davit used his first Kiva loan to buy a stove for baking lavash. Now he is seeking a $3,000 loan to purchase flour wholesale for his business.

loans.use: to purchase flour wholesale for his business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward has a timber business that he has been doing for the past six years. He is married to Jane and they have three children who are all in school.

Edward has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy more timber to add to his stock. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a staff member.

He hopes to expand his business and open a timber yard.

loans.use: To buy more timber.

loans.name: Lillian.

texts.en:
Lillian has operated her retail business in Olkalou town for the last two years. She is 35 years old, married to John, and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more sugar, flour and cooking oil to add to her stock.

In future, Lillian hopes to grow her retail business to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es: Carlos es un hombre de 32 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda su historia empezó dentro de su sector en su barrio no hay tiendas entonces empezó vendiendo arroz y cada vez le pan le pedían más, su trabajo lo realiza con su familia todo el día, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está casado, no tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener una despensa y un camión pequeño. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su tienda y asi comprar bebidas, enlatados, granos, dulces.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 32-year-old man who has a great desire to boost his business over the next few years.

Carlos decided to open his store because there weren't any stores in his neighborhood.  He started out selling rice and his customers asked him for more products.  He works together with his family every day.  The difficulty he faces is crime.  Carlos is married and does not have any children.  His biggest dream is to own a grocery store and a small truck.  He would like this loan for his store so that he can buy drinks, canned food, grains and candies.

loans.use: to buy drinks, canned food, grains and candies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Azat

texts.en:
Azat is 35 years old. He lives in the village of Sadzeli in South Georgia with his family: his wife, Alice, his parents and his younger brother. 

All his family members are busy with the family livestock farm. They purchase calves and keep them for five or six months. After this period, the family sells the grown calves for a higher price and gets income. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 GEL.

Azat requested a loan for purchasing calves. He will increase the number of calves in the farm and get increased income after six months. The family will use the additional income to purchase needed household goods and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Benotto

texts.en:
Benotto is 19 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and stopped her education at grade six. She has a 1-year-old child who lives with her.

For the past two years, she has been selling rice by cups in the local market. She enjoys her business because she has lot of customers, and the profit she generates helps her buy food for her family. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by bags for her business. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by bags for her business.

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah has operated her retail business in Nakuru town for the last six years. She is 34 years old and married to Elijah and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of rice, salt, match boxes and soft drinks for sale in her shop and therefore have enough stock to meet her customers' demands as well as to increase her income.

In future, Linah hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop and even build residential premises.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, salt, match boxes and soft drinks for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old, widowed, and has two children.  She has been in the shoe selling business in Nakuru town for the last four years.

Rose is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of new shoes to sell in her business.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of their field officers.  In the future, Rose hopes to open a shop and stock it with imported shoes and bags to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of new shoes to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 27 years old and married. She and her husband, Musa, are blessed with three children, ages 10, 3 and 1. Emily owns a grocery store, a business she started two years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

Emily is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase fruits and vegetables for sale. The profit she earns from this loan will help her buy a dairy cow for milk production in order to increase her income. 

Emily's hope is to one day buy a car as well as see her children get a good education. This is Emily's first loan.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en: Bindu is 30 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has four children, ages  6 to 12. For the past 5 years, she has been selling palm oil by the gallon in the local market. She makes a lot of profit because she sells quality palm oil and has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Bindu hopes to build a house and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen is 18 years old, single and lives in Buchanan. She stopped her education at grade 10. For the past 3 years, she has been selling used clothes in the market. She established the business with small loans from her father. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 41 years old and married to Charles. They are blessed with four children. She sells cereals in Kamulu, Tala. She has been in this business for the last three years and gets an income of 18,000 KES per month.

Rose has a good credit history with KADET, Ltd. She is applying for her second loan of 50,000 KES from KADET, Ltd., with which she plans to buy stock like beans, maize, and groundnuts. She will use the extra profit to pay school fees.

She hopes to have a business that has expanded fully and a family that has a good supply for its basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase stock like beans, maize, and groundnuts.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 48 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has four children, ranging in age from 16 to 28. All of them attend school. For the past 11 years, Hawa has been selling charcoal in the local market. She started her business with capital from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for her business. She hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia lives in the village of Abastumani in South Georgia with her family, including her husband, Avtandil, two sons (23 and 20 years old) and father-in-law. All family members are involved in the family agricultural business. They have a dairy farm where Lia produces cheese. Also, the family grows vegetables on a family-owned plot of land. 

Lia also runs a small grocery store in the village. She sells harvested vegetables as well as homemade cheese in her store. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 GEL.

Lia has requested credit so she can purchase calves. Avtandil will take care of the calves and feed them for six months. After six months, Avtandil and Lia will sell the calves for a higher price and earn additional income. The family will use the additional income to purchase necessary household goods and to improve family members' living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 43 years old. She supports her two children, ages 17 and 13 years respectively. She runs a tailoring shop as well as a grocery. She started tailoring 2 years ago and the business earns her a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 KES to purchase clothes materials for sale. The profit she makes will be plowed back into her business. Her dream is that one day she'll be able to build rental houses. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes materials

loans.name: Oganes

texts.en:
Oganes lives in the village of Skhvilisi, South Georgia. He is 31 years old, married and lives with his family: wife – Kristine, 5-year-old daughter and parents. Oganes works as a construction worker in his district. At the same time, he leads the agricultural business of the family. His mother assists Oganes. His father has health problems and gets a relevant monthly pension from the government. Oganes grows potatoes on a family-owned plot of land. He sells harvested potatoes in the village and to green grocery retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 300 GEL.

Oganes requested credit for purchasing better-quality potato seeds. He will get more harvest and sell it locally. The income of the family will increase. Oganes plans to use increased income for financing family daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 23-year-old single man who started a taxi business a year ago. He has requested a 20,000 KES loan to service his car. This is his first loan.

Profit from his business will help James repay his loan. His dream is to make his business big.

loans.use: to service his car.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie  is 35 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and has an 11-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. For the past 20 years, she has been selling biscuits and juices. She enjoys being self-employed.

Annie is requesting a loan to purchase more biscuits and juices for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits  and juices for her business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 25 years old and supports his brothers and sisters. Four years ago, he started a business selling second hand shoes, and now he earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

Daniel has requested a 30,000 KES loan to buy more shoes for sale. The profit he earns will help him repay his loan and increase his stock. This is his first loan. 

Daniel's dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for sale.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 40 years old. He lives in the village of Shoka with his family: wife – Pirimze, 18-year-old son and 15-year-old daughter. Both children go to school. 

Teimuraz leads the agricultural business of the family. He runs the family dairy farm with four milk cows. Pirimze and Teimuraz produce Georgian cheese and sell, on average, 80 kg of this product on the local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 300 GEL.

Teimuraz requested credit for expansion of his dairy farm. He will purchase a milk cow and will increase production and sales of cheese by 25%. The income of the family will increase. Teimuraz plans to use increased income for the well-being of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is from the village of Kumurdo. She lives with her mother-in-law and sister-in-law in the village. All of her family members are involved in the family's agricultural business, which is the only source of income for the family. They have a dairy farm with four milk cows. Oksana produces cheese and sells it in the local market. The family also owns 2.5 hectares of land, where they grow potatoes, wheat, and barley. They sell their harvested products locally to greengrocery wholesalers in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.

Oksana requested credit for purchasing quality potato seeds. She will sow good quality potatoes, which can be sold for higher prices to create more income for the family. Oksana plans to reinvest part of the received income in the same business, to sow more potatoes. Part of the income will also be used for financing the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for sowing.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 38 years old, married to Agnes, and is blessed with two children aged 14 and 10 years respectively. He is a farmer. He started the business five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase a generator for pumping water in his garden. The profit he makes from his business would help him buy a dairy cow for milk production. 

His dream is to one day become a large scale farmer and buy a large piece of land. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase a generator for pumping water in his garden.

loans.name: Mawulawoé

texts.fr:
Mawulawoé est une femme âgé(e) de 27 ans. Elle est mariée à comptable. Elle a 02 enfants .Le premier a 03 ans et le dernier a 01 an.  
Mawulawoé travaille comme revendeuse de condiments depuis 2009. Elle vend seule aux clients dans un marché et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Mawulawoé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des condiments. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Mawulawoé voudrait louer une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Mawulawoé is a 27-year old woman, who is married to an accountant; She has two children: the eldest is three years old and the youngest one year old. Mawulawoé has been working as a retailer of condiments since 2009. She sells alone to customers on the market and gets her supplies in Lomé. Mawulawoé has requested her first loan from WAGES so that she can buy condiments. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years she would like to rent a shop. She says that she will provide for her family's needs with the profits she makes.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Agbessi

texts.fr:
Agbessi est une femme âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée à un conducteur d’engin. Elle a 2 enfants. 01 va à l’école. Le premier a 26 ans et le dernier a 18 ans.
Agbessi travaille comme maraichère  depuis 1987. Elle produit et vend des produits maraîchers pour tous clients au grand marché de Lomé. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Agbessi a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des intrants pour la production des produits maraîchers. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Agbessi voudrait acheter un terrain à exploiter. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’impliquer sa famille dans la production.
texts.en: Agbessi is a 50-year old woman, who is married to an engine driver. She has two children, one of whom goes to school. The eldest is 26 years old and the youngest 18. Agbessi has worked as a market gardener since 1987. She produces and sells market gardening products to all types of customer at Lomé's Grand Market. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone and at the moment her main problem is a rupture of stock. Agbessi has requested her fourth loan from WAGES so that she can buy agricultural inputs for the production of her market gardening products. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Agbessi would like to buy a land to cultivate. She says that she is planning to include her family in the production with the profits she makes.

loans.use: to buy market gardening products

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr:
Fati est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 2 enfants, tous à l’école. Le premier a 5 ans et le dernier a 2 ans.
Fati travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2003. Elle vend des ignames et du charbon de bois pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toute sa clientèle.
Fati a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames et du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Fati voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Fati is a 38-year old woman, who is married to a driver. She has two children, who are both at school. The eldest is five years old and the youngest two. Fati has worked as a retailer since 2003. She sells yams and charcoal to all sorts of customers on the market. She buys the produce in Lomé and works alone. Her main problem at the moment is not to be able to satisfy all customer demand. Fati has requested her third loan from WAGES so that she can buy yams and charcoal. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the next few years, Fati would like to expand her business and she says that she will take care of her family with the profits she makes.

loans.use: to buy yams and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 34 years old and a mother of two children aged 14 and 7, respectively. She sells second hand clothes, a business she ventured into a year ago.  She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 14,500 that she will use to pay school fees for her children, this is her second loan.  Her dream is to be a millionaire one day.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 38 years old. She sells maize, which she has been doing for five years. 

Melanie is requesting a loan to buy more maize and upgrade her business. She believes that profits from the business will help her to build a house for her residence. In the future, she wants to sells a wider variety of foodstuffs.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to sell.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en: Speciose is 48 years old. She is requesting a loan to add more boutique items, such as salt, sugar, and soaps, to sell. With the profits, she plans to build a house. In the future, she plans to request a larger loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, soaps, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 38 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have four children between the ages of 8 and 19 years old, all of whom live at home and attend school. 

For the past twenty-four years Hellen has been selling rubber dishes in the local market. She gets a lot of profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes for her business. In the future, she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Baghdasar

texts.en:
Baghdasar is 33 years old. He lives in village Diliska, South Georgia with his family which includes his wife Goar, 3 year old daughter and 1 year old son. Goar is a housewife. Baghdasar works as loader in the village. Along with his job, he is responsible for the agricultural business of the family.  He grows potatoes on a family owned plot of the land. Baghdasar sells potatoes in the village to greengrocery wholesalers. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris.

Baghdasar requested a loan to purchase quality potato seeds and fertilizers. After proper cultivation and fertilization, the quality seeds will provide the family with a good harvest allowing the crops to be sold for a higher price. The income of the family will thereby increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mnatsakan

texts.en:
Mnatsakan is a 34-year-old farmer from Gorelovka village in South Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: wife Irina and three children (16, 14 and 6 years old). The children go to school.

Mnatsakan is leading an agricultural business for the family, which is the main source of the income for them. The family owns a dairy farm with 15 cows. Mnatsakan and Irina produce cheese and sell on average 350 kg of this product locally to dairy product retailers. Along with the agriculture, Mnatsakan is busy with trade. He sells clothing in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 laris. 

Mnatsakan requested credit for purchasing clothing from the wholesale market. He will re-sell the clothing in the village for a higher price and increase the income of the family. Part of the profit Mnatsakan will reinvest in the same business to increase turnover, and the other part will be used for the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Bobomurod

texts.ru: Бобомурод трудолюбивый и добросовестный семьянин. Он занимается предоставлением  транспортных услуг. Имеет собственную автомашину. На доходы содержит свою семью. В день он обслуживает много клиентов. Таким образом он зарабатывать на свою жизнь. Бобомурод запрашивает займ для ремонта своего автомобиля. Он надеется на вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Bobomurod is a hardworking and conscientious family man.  He is involved in providing transportation services.  He has his own car.  Bobomurod supports his family with the earnings from the business.  He serves many customers per day.  This is how he earns a living.  Bobomurod is requesting this loan to repair his car.  He relies on your kindness and help.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат разведен и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Более 5 лет он занимается перевозкой пассажиров. Имеет собственную автомашину. Полученные доходы помогают ему  содержать семью. Шухрат запрашивает займ для ремонта своего автомобиля. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Shuhrat is divorced and raising three children.  He is a very hardworking and kind person.  He has been involved in transporting passengers for over five years.  He owns a car.  The earnings from the business help him to support his family.  Shuhrat is requesting this loan to repair his car.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат замужем и заботливая мать четверых детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Более 3-х лет она занимается выращиванием сельхозпродукции. В основном она выращивает морковь и лук. Супруг помогает по бизнесу и является членом дехканского хозяйства. Каромат хотела бы получить займ для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений. Каромат надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Karomat is married and a caring mother of four children.  She is a very hardworking and honest woman.  She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over three years.  Karomat primarily grows carrots and onions.  Her husband helps her with the business and is a member of a dekhan farm.  Karomat wants to obtain this loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.  She relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is going on with her food and household goods trading business in Ijevan city. 

Now she has her own shop, which Alvard and her family were able to construct thanks to their business. 

This is Alvard’s fifth loan from Nor Horizon and second loan from Kiva. Alvard spent her first Kiva loan to buy fruits and household goods for her business. Now she needs a $1,000 loan to buy candy, cereals, coffee, tea, canned foods, and various detergents to resell.

loans.use: to buy candy, cereals, coffee, tea, canned foods, and various detergents to resell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 48-year-old single woman supporting eight members of her family. She owns a bar, a business she started 25 years ago. She has requested a loan of KES 10,000 to buy more crates of beer and soft drinks. This is her second loan.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soft drinks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esae

texts.en:
Esae is 51 years old, married, and has one adult child.  His mother also lives with the family.  He is lives in Alaverdi, South Georgia and is a farmer. His wife, Alvard, works as teacher in a local school. 

Esae is leading the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of the income for them. He grows potatoes, wheat, and barley on family owned land. Esae sells harvested products to local wholesalers.  Esae and Alvard also run a small dairy farm with two milk cows. Alvard makes cheese and sells it in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris, which includes the pension of Esae’s mother. 

Esae is requesting a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers. After fertilizing the land and sowing quality potatoes, the family will have a good harvest, which will be sold. The family will use the income for financing their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and potato seeds.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 34 years old. He is the father of five children and lives in a small village in South Georgia with his wife Tsitsino, children (6, 5, 4, 3 and 1 years old) and mother.

Agriculture is the main source of income for the family. The family owns a dairy farm with 2 milk cows. Nodar produces cheese and sells it locally to dairy product retailers. Also, Nodar grows potatoes on family-owned 0.4 hectares of land. The harvest is sold locally to retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 laris, including social assistance, which the family gets from the government as a family with many children. 

Nodar requested credit for purchasing seed potatoes. He will purchase quality seed of a good sort, which will be sold for higher price. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to provide better care for their children, purchase necessary goods for them and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang is a 27-year-old farmer. He is from Balanta village, South Georgia. Vakhtang is married and lives with his family: wife Zinaida and two daughters (4 and 2 years old).

Vakhtang is leading his family's agricultural business. He runs a small dairy farm with 3 milk cows. Zinaida produces cheese and sells it locally to dairy product retailers. Along with the dairy, the family grows potatoes and carrots on a family-owned plot of the land. Harvested vegetables are sold locally as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 laris.

Vakhtang requested credit for purchasing potato and carrot seeds, as well as fertilizers. After properly tilling and fertilizing the land, Vakhtan will count on a good harvest. After selling the harvest, the family will get a profit, which will be used for family needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and potato and carrot seeds

loans.name: Akarita

texts.en:
Akarita is 23 years old and married. She owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.    

Akarita needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2012, Akarita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Akarita's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour and oil.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga de 44 años, es una mujer soltera. Cuidó de sus 2 hijos: Emerson y Yusely, sola. Los ama mucho y viven juntos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Cajas. Gracias a su trabajo constante pudo lograr muchas cosas. Una de ellas es la venta de comestible, en su propia casa, ahí vende productos de primera necesidad como también toda variedad de bebidas de diferentes marcas y sabores, es la única que vende este tipo de bebidas por ello ya la conocen en su localidad. Además de poseer un ómnibus con el que realiza trasporte público entre las rutas conocidas de la ciudad, para ello contrata un chofer que se encarga del negocio. Pero la actividad que más satisfacción económica le dio; es la fabricación de ladrillos en una fábrica que tiene, ahí trabaja con ayudantes, a quienes les paga de acuerdo a la producción que realizan, cuanta que hace un promedio de 25 millares al mes y los comercializa en una feria reconocida, donde obtiene las ganancias de su trabajo. Ahora desea ver a sus hijos, realizados con una profesión y que puedan ser independientes y fuertes. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi banco” y este es el décimo octavo crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que obtendrá el préstamo que necesita para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son responsables y solidarios. Olga de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los ladrillos y si el dinero le alcanza comprará productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
44-year-old Olga is a single woman who has brought up her two children Emerson and Yusely on her own.  She loves them very much and they live together in their own home, in the town of Cajas.  Thanks to her constant work Olga has been able to achieve a lot, including opening a grocery business in her own home.  There she sells basic household products and a whole range of different brands and flavors of drinks.  She is the only person who sells these types of drinks so she is well known in her town.  In addition, she also owns a bus with which she provides a public transport system on known routes in the city.  She hires a driver to take care of this business.  However, the business activity that provides her with the most financial satisfaction is making bricks in a factory that she owns.  There she works alongside assistants who she pays according to how much they produce.  She says that she makes an average of 25,000 bricks a month and sells them in a well-known market.  This is where she sees the profits she makes from her work.  Now Olga would like to see her children with a profession and would like them to become independent and strong.

Olga is a member of the 'Mi Banco' community bank and this is her 18th loan from MFP.  She is grateful for your support because she will receive the loan that she needs to achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time because the members of her community bank are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Olga will invest the money she has requested in buying raw materials for making bricks.  If the money stretches far enough she will buy basic household products to stock her grocery store with as well.

loans.use: to buy materials for making bricks and basic household products with which to stock her store

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 53 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, está casada con su esposo hace muchos años, viven en su casa propia junto a su cuñada y sus cuatro hijos que ya son mayores e independientes. Carmen durante su trabajo, realiza muchas actividades, pero la principal es la venta de abarrotes, tiene un pequeño espacio acondicionado en su casa en donde espera a sus clientes que van en busca de cualquier tipo de producto que están seguros de encontrar ahí. Lleva haciendo éste trabajo ya por nueve años, y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es independiente, tiene tiempo disponible para realizar otras actividades, además de poder asistir de manera puntual y tranquila a su trabajo como docente de una institución educativa de la ciudad. En su negocio siempre tiene clientes, además como mantuvo un buen record de compras de una distribuidoras de gaseosas, le pusieron una exhibidoras para sus productos. Ella tiene grandes planes con su negocio, si bien por ahora el negocio está bajo, ella cree que más adelante podrá ampliar ya que uno de sus proyectos primordiales es el de agrandar su tienda de abarrotes. Este será el crédito número 18 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá una poyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, por su parte ella se compromete en pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará mas mercadería para ofrecer ya que los abarrotes están cambiando de precio y ella desea tener en mayor cantidad para poder vender a precio bajo y seguir teniendo a sus clientes contentos.
texts.en:
53-year-old Carmen is a cheerful and hard-working woman who has been married for many years.  She and her husband live in their own home together with her sister-in-law and her four children who are adults and no longer dependent on her.

Carmen carries out a number of business activities but her main one is selling groceries.  She has a small space set up in her home where she waits for her customers who come looking for all kinds of products that they know they will find there.  Carmen has been in this business for nine years and she has her husband's help.  What she likes about her work is that she works for herself and has time available to carry out other activities.  She is also able to turn up on time to her job as a teacher in an educational institution in the city.  Carmen's business always has customers and, because she had a good purchasing record with a soda distributor, they put one of their display cases for their products in her store.  Carmen has big plans for her business.  Although her business is low right now, she believes that in the future she will be able to expand because one of her main projects is to enlarge her grocery store. 

This will be Carmen's 18th loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as it will make her feel secure in making progress in her business.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time as she has with her previous loans.  She is happy to belong to her community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  Carmen will use the sum of 2,000 soles she has requested to buy more merchandise to sell because groceries are going up in price and she would like to have a larger quantity available so that she can sell them at low prices and continue keeping her customers happy.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to stock her store

loans.name: July

texts.es:
July, de 36 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de alegre y muy atenta. Es conviviente con Agner  quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus 3 hijos Jorbis, Leydi y Greys de 14, 9 y 3 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos están habitando cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza July es la venta de pollos. Su actividad empieza de madrugada hiendo a comprar su mercadería en la avícolas y granjas, luego los lleva a su puesto de venta en el mercado Bellavista, donde prepara y vende sus pollos, atendiendo de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes durante la mañana, retornando  a su casa  por la tarde. 
Se inició hace más de 1 mes, y hasta el momento le ayuda su pareja transportándola y acompañándola en la compra de su mercadería.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, pues logra vender todo los pollos de compra.
Decidió empezar con su negocio pues vio lo rentable que es, viendo las ganancias que deja en su cuñada quien la animo a dedicarse  este rubro.
Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que esta teniendo, desea hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar su capacidad de compra y venta, además en un futuro, abrir un restaurante en su casa ya que conoce de cocina. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, comenta que el gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal por considerarlo un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en aumentar su capacidad de compra de su mercadería de pollos para su negocio, buscando precios más bajos por el volumen, de es manera aumentarán sus ganancias.
texts.en:
July, 36, is a hard-working and resolute woman. She is also cheerful and very kind. She lives in common law with Agner, who works in transportation and is the father of her three children Jorbis, Leydi and Greys, aged 14, 9 and 3, correspondingly. They all live comfortably together in their own home. 
July sells chicken. She starts her work very early in the morning visiting poultry farms where she gets her product. She then takes the animals to her stand at the Bellavista market, where she prepares and sells them during the morning. She is very kind and friendly with her customers. In the afternoon she returns home.
July started this business over a month ago and so far her partner has helped her, transporting and accompanying her when buying the chicken. She considers this to be a profitable business because of the revenues and because she sells all the chickens she buys. 
She decided to start her business upon seeing how profitable it was for her sister in law, who convinced her to do this for a living. Given the results obtained, July wants to expand her business and increase her buying and selling capacities, as well as opening a restaurant in her house in the future because she is a good cook. This will be her third loan with MFP and she expects your help in order to take her plans to fruition. 
On the other hand, July says she likes the work at her Communal Bank because her group is united and supportive. The requested amount of 1300 nuevos soles will be invested in increasing the amount of chickens she can buy. She will get lower prices due to a larger volume, so her profits are expected to increase.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime, de 49 años es un hombre ejemplar. Vive en compañía de Juana, su esposa. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con Marieni la última, en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Aymara.  Se caracteriza por ser un hombre tímido y poco expresivo, pues como él dice. “Lo importante es trabajar con  mucho esmero”, es así que todos los días se dirige a sus campos de cultivos de tubérculos en general como: papa, olluco, oca y mashua, donde extrae la maleza y nutre con fertilizantes para que en cada cosecha le brinden buenos frutos. Además siempre va acompañado de su esposa, quien se dedica a cuidar de sus animales, entre ovejas, alpacas y caballos a los que cuida en su estancia, que se ubica en la zona alta, “el clima de los animales se adapta en las altura y ahí encuentran pastos naturales para que puedan alimentarse mejor”, afirma. Por ello está planeando comprar más alpacas, para incrementar su ganado, confiesa que obtiene mejores ganancias en la venta de estos animales, como también en la venta de lana. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “flor de papa” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollado, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias. Jaime de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para nutrir sus sembríos de papa de la variedad huairo y peruanita.
texts.en: Jaime of 49 years is an exemplary man.  He lives with his wife Juana.  Together they have four children, but they only live with the last one, Marieni.  Marieni lives in her own home, located next to Aymara.  He is characterized as being a shy and inexpressive man, but like he says: "working with great care is what is important."  So everyday he goes to his tuber fields; potato, olluco, oca, and mashua, where he hoes out the weeds and fertilizes so that each harvest will give him good fruit.  He is always accompanied by his wife who takes care of the animals on their farm; sheep, alpacas, and horses.  The farm is located in the high altitude zone, "the animals adapt to the climate at that altitude and there they find natural pastures on which to graze and feed themselves better," he affirms.  He is planning on buying more alpacas to increase his heard.  He confesses that he makes the best profit from these animals and also from the sale of their fleece.  He belongs to the supportive group called "flor de papa". This is his first loan with MFP where he feels like he is developing and receiving the necessary help to improve his business.  He promises to be on time with his payments.  He likes to work with his association, the people are responsible and supportive.  With their support he will invest the money requested in natural fertilizers to nourish his huairo and peruanita potato variety crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 51 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Ricardo, su esposo desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos: Cristian, Alison y Jessica en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de El Tambo. En este momento ella se siente feliz, pues su esposo consiguió trabajar como alfabetizador en el gobierno local, “su principal sueño”, comenta. Pues antes toda la familia conformó una empresa de pintado de locales con máquinas sofisticadas, gracias a su constancia, logró adquirir varios contratos para pintar colegios y casa, el servicio adicional que ella da es el pintado con diseños, sus buenas ganancias le permitirán adquirir más máquinas, cuenta que hace poco compra una comprensora más. Pero como es una mujer trabajadora, también se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y CD’S en un local que adquirió en por su casa, ahí vende su exquisito plato de comida, cuenta que quiere convertirlo en una fuente de soda, para poder trabajar con toda la familia, “mi hija y mi yerno me dudan en mis negocios, juntos trabajamos y terminamos muy rápido nuestro trabajo, somos un buen equipo”, culmina. Este es el crédito número  veintitrés con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que obtendrá el préstamo que necesita para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son responsables y solidarios. Julia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de CD’S para que venda en su negocio.
texts.en:
51-year-old Julia is a hard-working woman who lives together with Ricardo, her husband of 17 years.  The couple have four children and live with three of them (Cristian, Alison and Jessica) in their own home, in the town of El Tambo.  Right now Julia is feeling happy because her husband has got himself a job as a literacy teacher with the local government.  She says that this has been his 'big dream'.  

Julia's family set up a company which paints buildings using sophisticated equipment.  Thanks to her perseverance she was able to acquire several contracts for painting schools and homes.  She also offers an additional service painting with designs.  The good profits she makes allow her to acquire more equipment.  She says that a short while ago she bought an additional air compressor.  However, as she is a hard-working woman, she also sells hamburgers and CDs.  She sells delicious food and says that she would like to turn her business into a diner so that she can work with her whole family, "My daughter and son-in-law help me in my businesses.  We work together and quickly finish our work.  We are a good team" she concludes.

This will be Julia's 23rd loan from MFP and she is grateful for your support because she will obtain the loan she needs to achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time as all the members of her community bank are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Julia will invest the money she has requested in buying CDs to sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy CDs for her business

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David de 44 años convive con Lourdes, su incondicional pareja, 6 hijos: Nixson de 23, Crisayda de 21, Marcos de 19, Miriam de 16, Clider de 13 y Adelaida de 10 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia en el distrito de Tapo, provincia de Tarma. David es un hombre laborioso. Desde que unió su vida a Lourdes, se dedicó íntegramente a la agricultura. Ahora cuenta con terrenos de cultivos de papas y arvejas. “Siembro 10 sacos de semillas de papas y cosecho como 300 ó 400 sacos”, comenta. 
El éxito de sus cosechas depende de los cuidados que les brinda con el contante esparcimiento de abonos orgánicos, y la limpieza de la mala yerba. Así también siembra 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas que le otorgan como 70 sacos en la cosecha, cada uno lo vende a 80 soles, en estos días. En este trabajo cansado recibe el apoyo de sus hijos mayores, así se ahorra en el pago a los jornaleros, que pocas veces contrata.
Por su parte Lourdes se encarga de cuidar a sus animales, que constan de: 30 ovejas, 5 vacas y 3 cerdos. De la leche elabora quesos que los vende en su misma localidad y en la ciudad de Tarma. David tiene sus metas claras, ahora quiere arrendar otros terrenos para sembrar más arvejas. Éste sería su crédito número 11 que recibiría de MFP, gracias a su ayuda. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual enel pago de las cuotas mensuales como lo fue antes. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Río Blanco”, y le da gusto de formar parte de un grupo de personas responsables y luchadoras. Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas con 1200 soles, que aumentará con los ahorros que tiene.
texts.en:
David, 44, lives with Lourdes, his unconditional spouse, and six children: Nixson, 23, Crisayda, 21, Marcos, 19, Miriam, 16, Clider, 13 and Adelaida, 10.  They all live together in a house of their own in Tapo District, Tarma Province.  David is a hardworking man.  Since he joined his life to Lourdes he went into farming full-time.  He now owns fields where he grows potatoes and peas.  “I plant ten sacks of potato seeds and harvest about 300 to 400 sacks,” he comments.

The success of his harvest depends on the care he provides constantly spreading organic manure and weeding out the noxious weeds.  He also plants two sacks of pea seeds that produce 70 sacks at harvest; he sells each sack for 80 soles nowadays.  His older sons help him with the work so he saves on day laborer salaries which he very seldom hires.

On her part, Lourdes takes care of the animals which are 30 sheep, 5 cows and 3 pigs.  From the milk produced she makes cheese that she sells locally and in the city of Tarma.  David has clear-cut goals.  He wants to lease more land to plant more peas.

This will be MFP loan #11 thanks to your help.  Because of this he commits to be very punctual with his monthly installment payments like he’s been previously.  He belongs to the “Río Blanco” communal bank and it makes him happy to belong to a group of responsible, hardworking people.  He will use the money from the loan to buy two sacks of pea seeds for 1200 soles that he will augment with savings he has.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of pea seeds.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, de 27 años es un hombre singular. Vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos: Javier, Danitza y Jordi a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Aymará. Su esposa falleció hace apenas un año. Desde entonces cuida de sus hijos por el mismo. Su principal ingreso económico se centra en el cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo, donde siembra papa, olluco y maíz , los cuales comercializa a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde viaja constantemente, además cuenta que tiene animales como ovejas, vacas, cuyes y caballos. Donde también tiene ingreso en la venta de los animales cuando están gordos y con las vacas, vende la leche que producen, pero cuando tiene tiempo realiza queso, de esa manera dinamiza sus ingresos económicos. También realiza leña con los árboles maduros, de esa manera cocina los alimentos, pero cuando le piden sus vecinos también les vende algunos ejemplares. Ahora desea incrementar su capital de trabajo, para poder sembrar en todos sus terrenos agrícolas, pues tiene 2 hectáreas donde quiere sembrar toda variedad de tubérculos. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “flor de papa” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollado, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias. Félix de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
27-year-old Félix is a singularly good man.  He lives together with his three children, Javier, Danitza and Jordi, who he cares for in his own home, in the town of Aymará.  His wife died barely a year ago.  Since then he has cared for his children himself.

Félix's main business activity is caring for his farmland where he grows potatoes, 'olluco' (a native tuber) and corn.  He sells his crops in the city of Huancayo which he travels to often.  He also has animals such as sheep, cows, guinea pigs and horses.  He makes income by fattening and selling his animals and also from the milk that his cows produce.  Whenever he has time he makes cheese which boosts his income.  In addition to this, Félix also makes firewood from mature trees and this is how he cooks his food.  However, when his neighbors ask for some he also sells them some.  Right now, Félix would like to increase his working capital so that he can sow crops on all of his farmland because he has two hectares where he would like to sow a variety of tubers.

Félix belongs to the 'Flor de Papa' community bank and this is his first loan from MFP.  He feels like he is developing because he is obtaining the help he needs to make progress in his business.  With your support, Félix will invest the money he has requested in buying natural fertilizers to spread over his potato crops.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino de 44 está casado con Eusebia de 38 años, fruto de  este amor tienen  6 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Celestino es una persona buena, él se dedica al cultivo de cacao en su parcela ubicada en la comunidad de Nogal, actividad que lo realiza desde hace 22 años. Celestino siempre fue consecuente con sus objetivos y dedicado a sus cultivos con el único fin de obtener mejores cosechas y mayor ingreso económico. Ahora está pensando abrir una tienda de abarrotes con la ganancia de sus cosechas, de esa manera tener un ingreso más con el que pueda solventar los gastos de la familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que él se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles realizara el mantenimiento de su campo agrícola ( desyerbo y poda)para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Celestino, 44, is married to Eusebia, 38, and as fruit of their love they have six children; they all live in their own house located in Pichari District.  Celestino is a good person; he farms cocoa beans on a parcel located in the community of Nogal, an activity he’s been doing for the last 22 years.

Celestino has always been conscious of his objectives and dedicated to his crops with the only aim of obtaining better harvests and higher income.  He’s now thinking about opening a grocery store with profits from his harvests so that he can have an additional source of income to cover family expenses.  

This is his first loan with MFP so he commits to make his installment payments punctually.  He will use the 1500 new soles to hire day laborers to provide maintenance to his crops (weeding and pruning).

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Jackeline Baltazara

texts.es:
Jackeline tiene 31 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos los cuales están en edad escolar, cuenta con casa propia en la que vive junto a su familia en un caserío de nombre “Punto Cuatro” el mismo que esta ubicado a unos  10 minutos del distrito de Mochumí y que esta ubicado al norte de la provincia de Chiclayo.

Jackeline se dedica a la preparación de comida, kekes, tortas, sandwich, y otros postres (repostería) en su propio domicilio para lo cuenta con los hornos necesarios para su preparación, ella los comercializa en el colegio secundario de su caserío de lunes a viernes, y también atiende pedidos de sus vecinos los cuales ya conocen de su negocio, ha dicha actividad se viene dedicando ya un aproximado de 4 años y el mismo que ha sido el sustento de su familia, pues recibe el apoyo de su esposo debido que el también trabaja independientemente en la ciudad de Chiclayo en un taller de mecánica. 

Para Jackeline, la educación de sus hijos es lo más importante, y es por ello que junto a su esposo trabajan arduamente para darle la mejor educación a sus hijos pero, a pesar de obtener ingresos de la venta de postres y comida, no es suficiente para solventar todos los gastos escolares de sus 3 niños, y como para ella y su esposo consideran que la mejor herencia para sus hijos es la educación, no quieren dejar de comprar sus útiles para ellos.  Es por ello que está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles, con la finalidad de comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos y una parte para comprar insumos para preparar sus dulces. 

La familia de Jackeline es muy unida y muy querida en su caserío.
texts.en:
Jackeline is 31 years old, is married and has 3 children who are school aged. She has her own house in which she lives together with her family in a small town called "Punto Cuatro" which is located about 10 minutes from the district of Mochumí and is located north of the province of Chiclayo.

Jackeline prepares food, cakes, sandwiches y other desserts (pastries) in her own home for which she has the ovens necessary for the preparation. She sells them in the high school of her town from Monday to Friday and also fulfills orders from her neighbors which already know her business. She has been doing this job already for approximately 4 years which has been the livelihood of her family, as it is supported by her husband due to the fact that he also works independently in the city of Chiclayo in a mechanic shop.

For Jackeline, the education of her children is the most important thing, and for this reason her husband and her work arduously to give their children a better education. In spite of her earned income from her pastry sales it is not enough to cover all of the educational costs of her three children and since her husband and her consider the most important gift they can give to be education, they don't want to stop purchasing school supplies for them. For this reason she is asking for a loan from Edpyme of 2000 new soles to be able to purchase school supplies for her kids and to also purchase ingredients for her sweets. 

Jackeline  is requesting a loan to Edpyme Alternativa in order to purchase school supplies for the upcoming school season. It is a very beloved and close-knit family in her village.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies for her children and purchase ingredients to make desserts

loans.name: Winston Orlando

texts.es: Winston es un hombre de 28 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su panadería su historia empezó inicio en Manabí y emigro a Guayaquil para darle una hija educación a sus hijos, su trabajo lo realiza con su hijo mayor y su esposa de las 4:00 hasta las 22:00, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está casado y su esposa le ayuda con el negocio, tiene 4 hijos, su sueño más importante es tener otros productos para surtir su panadería. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su panadería.
texts.en:
Winston is a 28-year-old gentleman who has many aspirations of prospering his bakery within the next few years.  His story began in Manabí before he moved to Guayaquil so that he could provide his children an education.  He works with his oldest child and his wife from 4am to 10pm.  They encounter difficulties, such as crime.  Winston is married and his wife helps with the business.  They have four children.  

His greatest wish is to have other products for restocking his bakery.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for his business.

loans.use: to buy flour and cornmeal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, leader du groupe d’affaire «Unyenyekevu », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 55  ans, mariée, mère de 10 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un mécanicien. Elle est  vendeuse de sacs à main (second hand). Il y a  4 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  11eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  1 ballon de sacs, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement, accroitre son entreprise et acheter une seconde parcelle qu’elle léguera en  héritage à ses enfants.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client is an entrepreneur and head of the Unyenyekevu business group. She is 55 years old, married and the mother of 10 children, who are all in school. Her husband is a mechanic. 

She sells second hand handbags. She has been involved in small-scale business of this type for four years. This is her 11th loan from Hekima, and will enable her to buy one sack of bags, among other things. 

She would like to see her children grow up in comfort, expand her business and buy another plot of land to leave to her children. She would like to thank Hekima for its work helping poor women who are excluded from traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy one sack of bags, and other supplies.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mariana Elizabeth

texts.es: Mariana es una mujer de 19 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar en la venta de detergentes, jabòn y ropa. Su historia empezó hace 5 años cuando esta actividad le ayudo a obtener dinero vendiendo ropa, detergentes ya que tenía una pequeña despensa. Actualmente con su tío en un carro vende productos de bazar y de tienda como detergente, jabòn, fideos, aceites etc. En ocasiones el trabajo lo hace sola de lunes a sábado desde las 7 am hasta las 5 pm, no tiene dificultades, es soltera, no tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es terminar la universidad ya que esta estudiando. Por eso quiere el préstamo para la venta de su mercaderìa como ropa, fideos, detergentes, jabones etc.
texts.en:
Mariana is a 19-year-old woman who has great aspirations for growing her business in the coming years by selling detergents, soaps, and clothes.  Her story began five years ago, when this activity helped her obtain money selling clothes and detergents and had a small store.  She currently works with her uncle selling from a van the miscellaneous products with which she currently works, such as detergents, soaps, oils, etc. 

Sometimes she works on her own from Monday through Saturday, from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m.,  She doesn't face any difficulties.  She is single with no children, and her most important dream is to complete her university education for which she is studying.  For this reason, she wants the loan for her business to purchase more merchandise such as clothes, noodles, detergents, and soaps.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, noodles, detergents, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Cesar Manuel

texts.es:
Cesar Manuel tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, y vive en el Barrio Nueva Suyapa, Tela, Atlántida junto a su madre.
El es una persona emprendedora, desde hace 3 años se dedica a vender  chicharrones en bolsitas en ristras, también vende  especies, condimentos y tajadas de plátano. Anteriormente vendía helados en vasitos y un amigo le dio la idea de este otro negocio de vender chicharrones y otros. Comenzó distribuyendo en las pulperías en una bicicleta y ahora las distribuye en motocicleta. A este negocio le dedica desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 4:30 de la tarde, todos los días.
Con los prestamos anteriores que solicitó ha logrado incrementar sus ventas y las ganancias, actualmente solicita el tercer préstamo para surtir de productos, comprara la materia prima para hacer los chicharrones, especies, condimentos y plátanos, para preparar en bolsitas y hacer las ristras para venderlas. Su meta es seguir trabajando para hacer crecer su negocio y ser uno de los mejores distribuidores  de su comunidad, de esa manera obtener los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a su madre.
texts.en:
Cesar Manuel, 29, is single and lives with his mother in Barrio Nueva Suyapa in Tela, Atlántida.  He is an enterprising person who has been selling bagged bunches of chicharrones [fried pork rinds]; he also sells condiments and banana slices.  He used to sell ice-cream in little cups but a friend gave him the idea for this other business selling chicharrones and other things.  He started distributing on a bicycle to grocery stores and now he distributes on a motorcycle.  He works every day from 7am until 4:30pm.

With previous loans he requested he was able to increase sales and profits.  He’s currently asking for his third loan to stock up on products and to buy raw materials to make chicharrones, spices, condiments and bananas to fill his little bags and make the bunches to sell them.  His goal is to stay in business and to make it grow and become one of the best distributors in his community to thus obtain the necessary income to support his mother.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make chicharrones.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HACIA EL TRIUNFO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Elsa la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de kiosko ella vende golosinas,gaseosas,hamburguesas entre otros a las personas que le solicitan,a la vez la socia trabaja en una pre universitaria todos los dias y por horas,la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a us familia.

la socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de hamburguesa como carne,cebolla,sal entre otros.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the 'Hacia el Triunfo' community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Elsa divides her time between her daily activities and her kiosk business where she sells candies, soda, hamburgers and other products to people who request them.  She also works every day in an institution that prepares students for university.  She is a very cheerful and responsible person who has a great desire to continue making progress for her family's sake.  This is how she provides for her family.

Elsa is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making hamburgers such as meat, onion, salt, etc.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making hamburgers such as meat, onion, salt, etc.

loans.name: Fausto Reinaldo

texts.es: Fausto es un hombre de 49 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su comercio su historia empezó con el mercado de frutas pescado y mariscos ya que se había comprado una camioneta con la que distribuye su producto actualmente se maneja de esta forma para el comercio, su trabajo lo realiza solo todo el día, no tiene dificultades, está casado, tiene 1 hija, su sueño más importante es mejorar su vivienda. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su comprar cemento, arena, bloques y asi mejorar su vivienda para darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fausto is a 49-year-old man who has a great desire to boost his business over the next few years.

Fausto's business is selling fruit, fish and seafood.  He bought a small truck that he uses to distribute his products.  This is how he currently carries out his business.  He works alone all day long and doesn't experience any problems.  Fausto is married and has one daughter.  His biggest dream is to improve his home.  He would like this loan to buy cement, sand and blocks so that he can improve his home and provide his daughter with a better future.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and blocks

loans.name: Tauese

texts.en:
Tauese is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She owns and operates a general store, which she has been doing for one year.  She sells a wide variety of products to the local community.  

Tauese is requesting her first loan for 1,000 WST, which she will use to build up her inventory.  In 2012, she joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  Tauese plans to use the profit from her business to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Juana es una mujer de 54 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su comercio su historia empezó porque siempre le ha gustado trabajar y en la venta de pollos se gana y no tiene muchas complicaciones todo fue idea de su mama, su trabajo lo hace con mi hija todos los días, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene 8 hijos, su sueño más importante es tener un local amplio y ampliar mi negocio con otros productos. Por eso quiere el préstamo para mejorar su local comprando cemento, ladrillo, arena y asi que los clientes se sientan mas comodos;
texts.en: Juana is a 54-year-old woman who hopes to make progress in the next few years.  Her story began because she’s always liked to work and selling chickens is profitable and not too complicated.  Everything was her mother’s idea.  She works with her daughter every day and does not have any difficulties.  She’s unmarried and has 8 children.  Her most important dream is to have a spacious locale and to expand her business with other products.  This is why she wants the loan to improve her locale buying cement, bricks and sand so that her customers will feel more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and sand.

loans.name: Glenda Maria

texts.es: Glenda es una mujer de 34 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda su historia empezó su afán por mejorar su nivel debido lo hizo incurrir en la venta de víveres, su trabajo lo hace sola todo el día, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, su sueño más importante es tener un carro. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su tienda y asi comprar arroz, azucar, enlatados, bebidas.
texts.en: Glenda is a 34-year-old woman who hopes her store will make progress in the next few years.  Her story began with her eagerness to improve her standard of living which led her to sell foodstuffs.  She works alone all day.  Delinquency is a difficulty she faces.  She’s married and has three children.  Her most important dream is to own a car.  This is why she wants the loan for her store to thus buy rice, sugar, canned goods and soft-drinks.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, canned goods and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Guillermina Doris

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de materiales de construccion como cemneto,arena,yeso,la socia tambien se dedica al trabajo como docente del nivel primario,por medio de este negocio y trbajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construccion.La socia solicita el préstamo para cemneto,arena y yeso al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues selling construction supplies such as cement, sand and plaster.  She also works as an elementary school teacher.  Through her business and her job, she provides for her children.  The member's dream is to expand her construction supplies business.  She is requesting this loan to buy cement, sand and plaster wholesale.

The member is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and plaster wholesale

loans.name: Rosa Flor

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer de 49 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su ropa, prendas de vestir y boutique su historia empezó hace 4 años, su trabajo lo hace con su hija todos los días, si tiene dificultades es la delincuencia, está divorciada, tiene 4 hijos, su sueño más importante es terminar su casa y ver graduada a su hija. Por eso quiere el préstamo para INCREMENTAR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE PERFUMES, CREMAS,ROPA,ETC
texts.en:
Rosa is a 49-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her business selling clothing and personal care products over the next few years.

Rosa started her business four years ago.  She works together with her daughter every day.  The difficulty she faces is crime.  Rosa is divorced and has four children.  Her biggest dream is to finish building her home and see her daughter graduate.  She would like this loan to increase her business buying perfumes, creams, clothing, etc.

loans.use: to increase her business buying perfume, creams and clothing

loans.name: Glenda Rosario

texts.es: Glenda es una mujer de 40 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su bazar y papelería su historia empezó cuando por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo en los ingresos decidió ponerse el bazar y papelería, su trabajo lo hace sola todos los días, si tiene dificultades es la delincuencia, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, su sueño más importante es incrementar su negocio. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su bazar-papelería y asi comprar papeleria, cuadernos, plumas.
texts.en:
Glenda is a 40-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her stationery store business over the next few years.

Glenda started her business as she needed to help her husband with their household income.  She decided to set up a stationery store.  She works alone every day.  The difficulty she faces is crime.  Glenda is married and has three children.  Her biggest dream is to increase her business.  She would like this loan for her stationery store business.  She will buy stationery products, exercise books and pens.

loans.use: to buy stationery products, exercise books and pens

loans.name: Silvio Alejo

texts.es:
El señor Silvio tiene 42 años de edad vive en el municipio de Chimoré provincia Carrasco de la ciudad de Cochabamba, él y su esposa junto a sus hijos viven hace muchos años en Chimoré, 

Silvio es transportista de una línea interprovincial en el Trópico de Cochabamba, como muchas personas él trabaja en horarios redoblados para poder dar mejor nivel de vida a su familia y en el intento de poder realizar más viajes le ocurrió un accidente de tránsito , por motivos de cansancio Silvio quedo dormido unos instantes en un retorno de su viaje, afortunadamente no se registraron daños personales ni  materiales, llego a encunetarse en el carril de venida con la salvedad que su motor sufrió un golpe que lo dejo con serios daños, solo le sirvió para retornar ya que en un tiempo se desestabilizo y dejo de funcionar, Silvio tiene otras deudas que paga mensualmente, si no arregla su motor se quedara sin su principal fuente de ingreso y en consecuencia se endeudara más. 

Su esposa trabaja de costurera y con ingresos bajos; en este momento Silvio necesita un prestamos pequeño con interés que pueda alcanzar a pagar para poder rehabilitar su vehículo y así seguir trabajando para poder pagar sus responsabilidades y mantener a su familia como siempre lo hizo, por eso recurre a nosotros para solicitar un crédito ya que se enteró de los créditos Kiva y al señor  Silvio le interesó mucho este tipo de crédito y de esa manera poder beneficiarse.

Silvio tiene la esperanza que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor, pagar sus deudas y ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
